Kenji Takashi, a martial arts instructor
1.content: It had all happened so suddenly. Rustone city had been going about its business as if it had been any other day. People were walking down the busy streets with their kids. Shops closed early in preparation for the street fair. Silverstone amusement park was ready to kick off its annual Halloween celebration extravaganza. Then all of hell broke loose as the reappearance of the undead drove the population into a panic. Crowds swarmed through the street, eager to escape the madness. Innocents were killed as the zombified army grew. In only 3 days time there was no one left alive... or was there? You must once again take control of a survivor as they try to escape the nightmare they've found themselves in... but it won't be easy. Unlike Bitterwood, Rustone is much more isolated from civilization and crawling with brand new types of zombies... along with some old favorites. Four heroic survivors made it out of Bitterwood alive... will anyone make it out of Rustone? Choose wisely and find out...
1.title: It begins... again...

choices: His room at the Diamond Dust resort and hotel
Greg's Last Gas (gas station about one mile south of the city)
11.content: Very well. Where will Jack be starting?
11.title: Jack Crowley, a professional gambler

choices: He takes the elevator to the ground floor
He takes the elevator to one of the other floors
He explores the rooms on this floor
111.content:
The door to suite 387 creaked open with a slow groan as the only living man on the 7th floor of the Diamond Dust hotel stepped slowly out into the quiet abandoned hallway. A fully loaded gun was tightly gripped in his hand and ready to fire should something come along. "Fuck..." Jack groaned as he closed the door behind him and admired the fresh blood smeared on the wall. "This whole fuckin' place has gone to hell..." Three days ago he had decided to check out and be on his way. Three days ago the hotel was overrun by creatures that were only supposed to exist in horror movies or comic books. He had spent the previous night partying with some "friends" who he had met up with after he won a $10,000 jackpot in the casino downstairs. He got up late the next morning at 1:34 p.m. with a hangover and about a fifth of the money he had won the previous night. A few pieces of underwear and an empty sea of wine bottles had told him all he needed to know about how the party had gone. He had though lady luck was back on his side after a few weeks of slowly and steadly getting back on his feet, but she was only being a tease before throwing him out on his ass.


A woman was attacked in the lobby by... a thing... with massive arms that crushed her to a pulp. Jack had been heading to the front desk when he nearly caught a chair to the face traveling about sixty miles an hour. It missed him by inches. No one had known where the thing had come from, but it was soon joined by other walking horrors that made quick work of the guests. The security team fought valantly to the last man... although in the end it did little to stem the tide of oncoming zombies. Most of the guests made a vain attempt to get to the doors and fire exits... few even made it outside. Knowing he had no chance of making it to the city from the desert with these things about Jack made a run for the elevator and pressed a random button as quickly as he could. The door closed just as a cocktail waitress with a bleeding neck wound collasped on the floor in front of him. The last sight he saw as the elevator made its ascent was of a massive zombie closing in on the defenceless woman. Seconds after the door closed he heard her scream, a scream that would haunt his nightmares for the rest of his life... however short it may be. By chance, the floor the elevator stopped on was 7, the very place he had just left mere minutes ago.


A weak laugh escaped his lips at the sheer irony of it all. The screams continued as he walked back into his room to enjoy his last few minutes of life. Hours pasted as he druck away his sorrows with the alcohol he still had. The only thing that kept him from commiting suicide by overdose was the thought of being trapped without booze should he fail. On his second day he finally ran out of the cheap beer he had drunk once he had polished off the rest of the wine. Fortunately, the screams had worn down to about once or twice every few hours and he was so inebriated he didn't care. "I shudda O.D.'d when I had the chance." He slurred as he looked at the barrier preventing entry to his room and fell asleep. On his third day he grew tired of waiting for death to come and decided to go find it on the outside. It might not be quick or painless, but it was better then waiting for one of those things to find him. He was about to take down the barricade when he noticed something sitting under an overturned glass bowl on the table...

It was a fully loaded handgun.


Jack had no idea how it had gotten there or how he had failed to notice it before now. It was possible he had taken it off a security guard when he ran, after all, he had such an adrenaline rush at the time that with everything else going on the whole event was a huge blur. Maybe it had belonged to someone who he had invited up to his room, he DID only know those people for a few hours before he got drunk off his ass at his success party. He couldn't know for sure, and probably would never know. However, one thing was for sure... lady luck wasn't ready to completely abandon him, at least not yet. He walked down the hall and looked out over the balcony at the courtyard in the center of the hotel below. Images from his brief stay here flashed through his mind. What was once a bright and cheery 5 star hotel was now a glorified graveyard. Bodies were strewn about all over the ground, some sprawled out in chairs, some floating in the pool, some were even hanging off the balconies across from him. There was some movement and noise on the floors below him and he could see zombies shambling in the bright midday sunlight of the courtyard, though, thankfully no one was left on this floor. At least, no one breathing. Jack took a deep breath... and headed out.
111.title: Lady luck can be a kind angel or a cruel bitch...

choices: Wasting no time, Jack makes a beeline for his car
Jack tries to run past it back into the lobby and get to the elevator
Jack remembers he has a gun and tries shooting it
1111.content:
Jack was much more confident now that he had a relible weapon to defend himself with, though he still exercised extreme caution as he made his way to the elevator. As soon as it arrived he got on and headed to the ground floor, ready to escape this hell once and for all. All he had to do was get to his car in the parking lot and he could drive and drive until Rustone was out of his life forever. "Maybe I'll head to Canada next, more snow, but less zombies." He joked to himself to keep his spirits up. The glass door opened with a soft ding as Jack stepped out into what remained of the lobby. The whole placed looked like a massive crime scene with dozens of bodies laying about, some in pieces, some little more than a bloody smear with a few entrails. Over on one of the walls were the words "help me" written in blood just above a corpse with her stomach carved open. "Jesus H. Christ..." Jack wispered as he stood for a moment to take it all in.


Once he had regained his senses he stepped forward towards the front doors across a room that seemed to be a mile long. Footsteps echoed throughout the large room as Jack stepped carefully around dead bodies and their luggage in the eerie dimness. "Of course the lights had to be out..." He said sarcasticly as he tried not to imagion what might jump out at him from a dark corner of the room.
Just as he was about to push open the doors that would lead to his salvation Jack felt a chill run down the back of his neck as something stirred in the darkness behind him. He turned around and was met with the most horrifying sight of his life. There, in the darkness, was a large humanoid figure with glowing red eyes and a pentagram mark taking up most of its forehead. Even in the poor lighting Jack could tell the thing was smiling at him all the way from the other side of the lobby.


A second passed as Jack stuggled frantically to find the strangth to push the door open before the abomination charged at him with a mighty roar. "OH SHIT!" Jack swore as he accidentaly shoved the door open behind him, causing him to fall onto the hard sidewalk outside. The warm sunlight was hardly a blessing as Jack hurried to his feet and was horrified to see that the thing had already made it through 2/3 of the lobby and was about to tear through the door. Mere seconds before the impact Jack managed to dive off to the side to avoid the blast of metal shrapnel and glass that exploded forth as the level 3's powerful claws obliterated one of the doors. The second door soon followed as the powerful zombie took its first few steps outside, its eyes searching for the man who had just narrowly avoided a quick and painless death at its hands...
1111.title: Time to cash out...

11111.content:
"Fuck! Fuck! Fuck! FUCK!" Jack whispered under his breath as he ran down the sidewalk towards the parking lot on the north side of the building. Another roar from behind quickly told him that the thing had once again spotted him. No easy escape for him today. "Shit!" Jack cursed as he spun around and fired 2 shots into the things chest as it charged after him. A few trails of blood began pouring down its stomach, but that was it. "Just what in the high hell ARE you?!" Jack groaned, exasperated. The monster made another swipe for him just as he turned the corner, narrowly avoiding death once again as bits of the building flew past him. He spotted his car, but knew it was too far away for him to make it in time so he turned around for what would probably be the final fight of his life.


For a moment the level 3 didn't move or make a sound... it just stared at Jack as if it was mildly surprised that he had given up. Not one to play the fool Jack took this oppertunity to draw his gun and make the first strike. Two more bullets sunk deep into its pale grayish-white flesh, but the creature payed its minor wounds no mind as he readied itself for another charge. This was it, Jack wasn't sure how many bullets he had left and the ones he had already spent didn't do a damn thing. Poker had taught him to make the best of the hand you were dealt and that even a poor deal could be turned into a jackpot with a little risk and some skill. Jack swallowed hard as he took careful aim with whatever ammo he had left. The thing was almost upon him when he focused on his target.


He furiously squeezed the trigger of the gun as many times as he was able while keeping the firearm pointed at its target. The last thing Jack saw as he lept out of the way was a flash of red cover the monsters face. The gun, long since emptied, fell out of his hand onto the ground as he backed up against the car. His last ace in the hole had been spent. A gentle breeze began blowing as his foe remained motionless. If it showed any sign of movement, any hint of life, it would all be over... "Well...?" Jack asked as he tried catching his breath. The level 3 zombie fell forward without a sound other than that of its dead body hitting the pavement. It was gone, killed with a bullet that destroyed the mark keeping it alive. "So thats it... you gotta destroy that glowing symbol on their forehead..." Jack noted as he picked up his empty gun. "Guess thats one good thing to know..." In less than a minute he was pulling out of the hotel and heading onto the highway...
11111.title: The bigger they are...

Jack thought to himself. He cruised the city streets, which were littered with devastation from the previous outbreak. After several minutes of driving through the deserted street, Jack came across,
111111.title: He heads towards Rustone

1111111.title: An abandoned gun store

111111112.content:
After driving for a few minutes his car began to run out of gas and stopped on a street filled with apartment complexes as well as a small nearby park. There were a few zombies stumbling about, but none of them had noticed Jack and were mostly much farther down the street. "Crap, I forgot to have this thing refilled when I came into town. Guess I'll have to continue on foot for now. If I can find a gas station I might be able to obtain a new car with some fuel." With that he took one last quick look around and stepped out of his car and onto the sidewalk. The sun was a bit higher in the sky now so it was probably about noon, which meant Jack had about 8-10 hours to get a new vehicle by nightfall.


He began walking down the street with his uzi out and ready to fill any threat he came across with lead. The mess of the torn Halloween decorations and dead bodies were much easier to see up close now and sent a few shivers up Jack's spine as he walked. When he came to the end of the street he noticed a large banner hanging from what looked like a hospital. The only symbol on it was a big blue R in a circle that was painted on with a few splashes of other colors. Crowley wasn't sure what it meant, but there was probably a good chance there were survivors nearby. The question is, would it be worth wasting time on that could instead be used to locate a gas station?
111111112.title: Do you check in or move on?

Offer trade some of Kyles supplies
1111111121.content: Jack decided to search the hospital for any survivors. "I hope someone has survived all this." Jack said to himself as he walked through the hospital entrance and into the waiting area, holding his Uzi close to him. There were mangled corpses strewn everywhere, many of them wearing hospital gowns and operating garbs. He then proceeded down one of the empty corridor. Jack continued down the hallway for several minutes. Suddenly, he heard a noise come from the room just ahead of him. Jack tensed, not knowing what it was. He approached the door cautiously, gripping his Uzi tightly. Suddenly, a middle aged man with black dreadlocks, wearing a camouflage jacket, blue cargo pants, and black biker boots leapt out of the room. He was holding an M16 assault rifle and had it pointed at him. Jack aimed his Uzi at the man, unsure what he would do. "What are you doing here?" the man shouted, his voice thick with a Jamaican accent. "I'm not looking for any trouble." Jack said calmly. "I'm just another survivor.". The two men stood there, for several minutes. Then he lowered his M16. Jack lowered his Uzi, sighing with relief. "Sorry about that pal." he said "Things have just been pretty tense.". "That's an understatement." Jack replied with a chuckle. "My name is Jack, by the way." Jack said, holding out his hand. "Name's Kyle." the man said, while he shook Jacks hand. Kyle then led Jack into the room he came out of. He had a large sleeping back placed on the floor and two duffel bags full of food, water and various weapons. The two then sat on the floor. Jack then decided to,
1111111121.title: Jack checks out the hospital

11111111211.content:
"So why don't you tell me a little about yourself." Jack said as Kyle inspected his M16. "I was one of the bouncers at the local bar." Kyle said "It wasn't the best job in the world, but I gave me a chance to kick someone's drunk ass.". Jack chucked a little. "So where'd you get all the heat." Jack asked. "I took what was left from the police armory." Kyle replied.

"What about you?" Kyle asked. "I've been here since my teenage years." Jack replied "I decided to drop out of high school after I discovered I had a talent with poker. I hit the road and decided to make my own fortune. I've had my ups and downs but was able to make a decent living.". Kyle nodded slightly.

"So how do you plan on getting out of this hellhole?" Kyle asked. "Well, I know we won't stand a chance going on foot." Jack replied "We need a car.". "The parking garage next door should still have some working vehicles." Kyle said, gathering up his supplies. "Sounds like a plan." Jack said. The two of them then walked out of the room and into the deserted hallways. An hour or so later,
11111111211.title: Ask Kyle a little bit about himself

The two managed to reach the parking garage, and found it was a complete mess. There were wrecked and abandoned vehicles everywhere. Numerous mangled corpses were strewn everywhere. There was even the charred frame of what appeared to be a station wagon, that was still burning slightly. "Fuck." you heard Kyle say under his breath. "Let's get to work finding some wheels." Jack said as the two started to search for a suitable vehicle, keeping an eye out for any zombies.

After several minutes, Jack found an abandoned minivan and managed to get it started. Kyle leapt into the drivers seat and Jack drove out of the parking garage and onto the empty streets of Rustone. Many buildings had been severely damaged or destroyed. Wrecked or abandoned vehicles were strewn everywhere. Mangled bodies littered the streets and sidewalks. "You think were the only one's left in the city?" Kyle asked, holding his M16 close to him. Jack shrugged and replied "I don't know.". Jack continued driving for several minutes. 111111112111.title: They reach the parking garage

"Cleanup on Aisle 14." Jack said to himself, chuckling as he reloaded his Uzi.

The shelves inside were almost cleaned out. Jack took a small basket from a shelf next to the door and started grabbing snack items off of the shelves. He then dug into a small bag of Doritos chips. "It's been a while since I've had anything to eat." he thought to himself. He then grabbed several cans of soda and beer from the drinks section. He then carried everything back to the van. After climbing back into the drivers seat, he started the engine and drove out of the lot and onto the streets, continuing south. After driving for several minutes,

111111112212.title: Search the abandoned vehicles for any supplies

Jack stopped as he spotted an abandoned grocery store a few yards ahead of him. There were several abandoned vehicles surrounding the store. Jack figured he'd still be able to get a new vehicle, and grab some food from the store as well. Jack rushed up to the store and approached the entrance. Jack suddenly remembered he still had his handgun. He grabbed it and took aim at the zombies head. He closed his eyes and squeezed the trigger. A deafening bang rang out, followed by the sound of a body hitting the pavement. Jack opened his eyes to find the zombie was laying at his feet, a large bullet hole piercing its head. He breathed a sigh of relief. "That was too close." Jack said to himself "One thing is certain, these things aren't human.".

Jack then turned around and took a good look at his surroundings. The whole city looked like a ghost town. There were wrecked or abandoned vehicles all over the road. Numerous mangled corpses were scattered everywhere. Several buildings were severely damaged. "This is worse than I thought." Jack thought to himself. Jack then spotted a gun store just across the street. He also saw the hotel's parking garage a few feet away. Jack knew he needed to get to his car and get out of the city, but he was considering going to the nearby gun store and salvaging whatever was left in the store, in case he needed it. After several minutes of thinking, he decided to,

1113.content:
Jack knew the floors below him were probably crawling with zombies and that he wouldn't last long with just a handgun. The floor he was on now, however, seemed to be clear... just a few bodies here or there along with some day old blood stains. The entire placed looked like Freddy or Jason had just came through to start their own vacation, but at least it was safe... for now. "Guess I better hurry before those things decide to check out the higher floors..." Jack mumbled under his breath as he walked around to a row of rooms on the north side of the hotel. "Room 394, 395, 396, 397, 398, and 399... not really my lucky numbers... or maybe they are." Jack said as he slowly pulled the door to suite 394 open and stepped inside. The place was pretty clean except for a shattered lamp and overturned chair, which was a pretty good sign. "Alright, hopefully I'll find something useful in here." Jack said, trying his best to sound optimistic.


The living area was pretty much empty along with the bedroom and bathrooms, but the kitchen had a fire axe laying on the counter next to a bowl of rotting fruit. "Well now, I don't know how you got in here, but I'll take ya." Jack said as he opened the refridgerator and took out a bottle of water. After a quick sip he sat it back down and picked up his new axe. "Shit, my hands are getting full... need to find a backpack or something." Unfortunately, there was no backpack in this room or the next, which meant Jack would have to make do with just his own two hands for the time being. The next few suites he visited were cleaned out of anything useful, save for some food and drinks Jack couldn't take with him. By the time he had made it to room 399 he was starting to get tired and took a few minutes to rest and try to figure out what to do next. He chugged down a few mouthfuls of champaign from a half empty bottle and spent a few minutes staring at the ceiling. "Christ, what AM I going to do...?"

He saw it was a Colt AR-15 assault rifle with a M203 grenade launcher attached to it. There was also a duffel bag filled with spare ammunition and extra weapons. "Whoever left this." 11132.title: He heads a higher floor

11133.content:
Jack didn't want to try and leave yet since he only had a handgun and axe, but searching the rest of these rooms seemed fruitless. "Well shit..." He groaned as he headed out of room 399 back towards the elevator. "I still don't want to make a trip to the ground floor unless I know its completely safe, but if I run into any of those things on one of the other floors I could probably outrun or kill them if I had to. Those things haven't even made it to most of the higher floors anyway... I should be safe." He decided to make a short trip down to floor 3 where a cute girl had slipped him a number the night he had hit the jackpot. "Room 148... I wonder if she's still here... or even alive for that matter." Jack thought to himself as the elevator came to a stop and opened its doors. In all honesty floor 3 didn't look much better than floor 7, but at least Jack was a few floors closer to making his escape.


"Alright... I've got a gun and I've got a freakin' axe... bring it." He taunted, knowing that no one was around to hear him. He walked down the short hallway and looked over the balcony at the pool just a few floors below. "God... it looks even worse up close... those poor bastards didn't stand a chance against these monsters..." He turned away and continued on to room 148, ignoring the others along the way. "If there isn't something here I'm just going to try and make a run for my car, even if those things get me its better than spending the last hours of my life going through dead people's stuff." The door to the room in question soon came into view near the end of a darkened hallway and Jack carefully made his way over and went inside. It was hard to see as the only light came from a window that was covered up by a shade, but there was just enough for Jack to be able to search the area directly in front of it. The creepy twilight effect unnerved him, but he soon came upon a tiny flashlight keychain attached to a handbag. "I suppose this is better than nothing..." Jack sighed as he put it in his pocket. "If I need to search any cabnets or closents this'll be useful."


He was about to walk over to remove the shade covering the window when he heard somethin stir in the bedroom. "That can't be good..." He whispered to himself as he pulled the cover back to allow a wave of warm sunlight to flood into the room. "Please don't let that girl be in here... please don't let that girl be in here..." Jack chanted softly to himself as sat his axe down on the couch and approached the door with just his gun. He turned the knob and the door swung open as Jack readied himself to fire at anything that jumped out at him. "Oh my god..." He moaned as he covered his mouth with his hand. There, on the bed was the exact same girl he had seen a few days before, the one who had handed him the number and asked him to drop by before he left. Both her wrists were slit and a blood coated razor was tangled in the red sheets under her arms. "Fuck." Jack groaned as he turned to leave, only to hear a deep growl echo from the shadows behind him. He spun back around just in time to catch a flash of red as something tackled him to the ground. The gun fell from his loosened grip as the massive zombie who had him pinned to the ground began choking him with its large hands...
11133.title: Harder to breathe

111331.content: Jack started throwing hard punches at the zombies face. They were hard enough to make it release it's grip on his neck. This gave him enough time to shove it off of him. He then picked up his pistol, just as the zombie was getting back up. Jack fired several rounds into its face. The zombie fell backward onto the floor, its face riddled with bullet holes. It took Jack a few minutes to realize he'd used up his ammo. "At least I've still got an axe." he said, discarding the empty firearm and retrieving the axe. He then decided to,
111331.title: Jack tries to fight the zombie off

1113311.content: Jack decided he'd better get to his car if he wanted to get out of the city. He quickly made his way downstairs to the parking lot near the hotel where he found his car was intact, much to his relief. Jack was about to get in when he noticed something on his windshield. He picked up and looked at it. He realized it was a map of Rustone, and there were several areas in the city that were circled in red with the word "Safe" written in each circle. Jack slipped into his car, started the engine and drove out of the parking lot, onto the deserted streets of the city. After several minutes of driving,
1113311.title: Head downstairs to his car

choices: Jack ignores the man and makes his escape
111332.content:
The large brute kept his hands on Jack's throat as it grinned with excitement. It had been all alone for a while now and a human had finally wandered in of its own free will! Jack wheezed a bit as he made a grab for the handgun, but it was just out of reach, another inch and he would have had it. "God damn you...!" Jack choked out as he delivered a punch to the dead mans jaw. A tooth slipped from its mouth as blood began running down its lips, but it kept its hands in place. "This is it... I'm going to die..." Jack though as he began to feel lightheaded. With the last of his strangth Jack twisted his body away from the zombie. The monster didn't even notice as it was too busy watching Jack's face change color, but it was enough to give the sauve gambler one last chance to escape.


Jack tried desperately feeling around for his gun as his vision began dimming. "No! NO! Don't pass out now, god damn it!" Jack thought as his hand felt nothing but an empty floor. Jack began to faint right as his hand touched cold metal and without a word he pointed the gun and fired 2 shots into the zombies chest. The man groaned as blood began covering his chest and softened his grip a little. "Thank god, one more." Jack whispered as he took aim and put a bullet in the bastards left eye. The body went limp and collapsed just as Jack himself passed out. It had been a close call, yet he had managed to survive by the skin of his teeth. "Guess lady luck has decided to come back to me..." Jack said softly as the room disappeared in a sea of black.


It would be a while before Jack woke up, though wether it had been hours or merely minutes he was unsure of. The sunlight from the open window warmed his head and a thick liquid could be felt slowly running down his body. Jack opened his eyes and shielded them as he shoved the body of the man aside and pulled his legs out from under him. He had a bit of a headache and his suit was now badly stained with blood, but other than that he was fine. "Christ, how long was I out...?" He groaned as he picked up his gun and axe and walked over towards the door. "Thats it, I'm getting out of this place... now." He opened the door and began walking down the hallway towards the elevator when he heard a man call for help. "Hey, that sounded like it came from close by!" Jack shouted as he began looking around to see where the cry for help had come from. There, on the balcony across from him, was a middle aged man grappling with a strange zombie with glowing green eyes. "What the hell...? What is that thing?!" Jack gasped as the man screamed again, this time a lot louder...

Jack spotted a Franchi SPAS-12 shotgun sitting on the nearby bedstand.

He snatched it up and loaded a shell. He then took careful aim and fired once, hitting the zombie in the head. The remains of the abomination tumbled over te balconys edge. The man then grasped the bars on the balcony and slid into a sitting position, gasping in large breaths. He managed to utter a "Thanks" before standing up again. "You OK." Jack asked, helping the man up. "Fine" the man said, brushing off his green sweater and black sweatpants. "I'm Jack." Jack said, holding out his hand. "Derek." he replied, shaking his hand vigerously. After a few minutes of talking the two decided to head out when
1113322.title: Jack tries to help

112.content: Jack had wound up having a 3 day hangover while in Ruststone. Now he was cornered in the Platinum Palace, a local bar, with at least a dozen level 1 zombies filling up the nearby area. He had barricaded himself behind the bar counter, occasionally using a broken wine bottle to take out a zombie with quick precise jabs. He already had several close shaves already. "If this shit keeps up any longer, I'l be dead as my bitch grandma." he said to himself. He waited for several minutes after slashing a zombies chest open with a broken shard of glass. Suddenly,
112.title: The customers are getting rowdy...

Jack begins further barricading the room
1122.content:
The zombie Jack had slashed with his broken bottle reached out and grabbed his shoulder, all while dripping blood all over the front of its shirt. "Jesus, how the fuck are you still alive?!" Jack shouted as he wretched himself free and shoved the zombie to the ground, realizing too late that he had attracted the attention of a fresh zombie that had been walking past the outside of the bar. A pair of glowing green eyes peered inside from the shadowed hallway leading to the front door. "Shit, that thing has green eyes... it must be some kind of different variant of stiff than the slow red eyed one. I need to get out of here!"


The Infector let out a sharp growl as it gave chase after Jack, limping along at a fairly quick pace despite its twisted leg and missing toes. Jack knew that the stairs leading up to the managers office would at least slow the monster down, if not stop it outright. As soon as he reached the door at the end of the upstairs hallway he turned the knob, only for the door to stop suddenly after opening only an inch. "Damn it, the door must be barricaded on the other side!" Jack cursed as he moved over to the side window and smashed it with his foot.


The window was fairly small, but just big enough to fit a large human male if need be. Jack wasted no time in pulling a chair out of the opening and throwing it aside as he climbed inside the managers office onto a wooden desk. By now the Infector had cleared the stairs and was seconds away from following Jack into the room. Panicking, Jack quickly jumped off the desk and sealed the window with a larger chair sitting on the nearby floor. He knew it wouldn't hold long and began to desperately search the room for a weapon.


The chair was pushed aside just as Jack noticed a shotgun sitting in the managers chair behind his desk... propped up against the managers rotting corpse. "Please, just let it have a shell left!" Jack yelled as he pried the weapon out of the corpse's cold hands and leveled it with the Infector's head just as it began limping forward. A single blast rang out as Jack squeezed the trigger and the zombie lost half of its face before falling to the ground. "Thank god..." Jack mumbled as he let the shotgun fall out of his hands. For the moment he was safe...
1122.title: Zombie management

choices: Jack reaches an abandoned gun store
11221.content:
Jack started to rummage through the office, looking for anything else that might be useful to him. He managed to find a hand crank powered flashlight radio, and a plastic bag with extra ammo for his shotgun. He also found a mini fridge that was packed with bottled water and soda. Jack sat on the floor next to the desk and sipped on a can of Diet Coke as he replayed the events of the last few days in his mind.

Jack had won $200,000 at the local casino and had been celebrating by inviting several women into his hotel room for some drinks. After 4 bottles of whisky, the rest of the night had passed in a blur. Jack had woken up with a serious hangover, and only $2,000 left in his wallet. His confusion had been made worse by the appearance of these undead monsters. Luckily, he'd managed to reach the bar and hunker down for several days.

"I don't know what had happened, but I've got to get out of this hellhole." Jack said to himself, flinging the now empty soda can aside. He then picked up his new shotgun. Before climbing out the window, he looked at the mangled corpse of the bar manager. He gave a silent apology before climbing out. He then went down the stairs, through the main bar, and out the front door. Jack got a good look at the damage caused by the outbreak. There were wrecked or abandoned vehicles scattered all over the streets. Numerous mangled bodies littered the pavement. Many of the surrounding buildings were damaged or destroyed. "It's like a warzone out here." Jack said to himself. He held his shotgun close as he walked down the street. After walking several blocks,
11221.title: Jack searches the managers office

choices: Jack finds a group of survivors
112211.content:
Jack spotted what looked like a gun store a few feet ahead of him. A sign above the door said "Greg's Gun Store.". Just below that sign was another that said "We carry all the latest equipment.". Although the windows were boarded up, the store seemed to be untouched. "Maybe I can grab some extra weapons." Jack said to himself "This shotgun won't protect me forever.". Jack walked toward the door and pulled it open.

He walked into the store and found it was empty. Shell casings and bullet fragments were scattered all over the floor. Jack walked behind the store counter to find a mangled corpse slumped against it, an AK-47 laying across his lap. Jack placed his shotgun on the counter, reached down and pried the AK-47 from his hands. "Sorry." he said quietly "But I'll be needing this more than you.". Checking the magazine, he was pleased to find it was full. "I'll still need more than this." Jack said to himself. He picked up a duffel bag from behind the counter and stuffed his shotgun into it. He then grabbed several other weapons from the wall rack. He picked up a small hunting rifle with a scope, several pistols, and an Uzi. He put them into his duffel bag, along with several boxes full of ammunition. He then slung the bag over his shoulder and picked up his AK-47 and ventured back into the streets. He held his AK-47 close to him, keeping an eye out for any zombie. After walking for several blocks,
112211.title: Packing heat.

1122112.content:
Jack had walked at least 5 blocks when he heart a strange thumping noise coming overhead. He looked up to see what looked like an army helicopter flying high above the buildings. Jack started jumping and waving, trying to get the pilots attention. However, the pilot didn't notice him and continued flying onward. Jack was about to loose all hope when he heard a voice coming from the helicopter. "To anyone who can hear this, proceed to The Masters Ace casino for evacuation. Repeat, proceed to The Masters Ace for evacuation.".

Jack's heart lifted when he heard those words. "That chopper might be my ticket out of here." he said to himself as he started jogging toward the center of the city where the casinos were. As he came closer to the downtown area, the damage that surrounded him began to get considerably worse. Many of the buildings around him had sustained significant damage, or had been torn apart completely. Wrecked or abandoned cars were strewn all over the street. Jack had been jogging for at least a half an hour when,

Jack said to himself as he laid his AK-47 and his duffel bag in the passenger seat. He found the keys were in the ignition and managed to get the engine started. Putting the police car into gear, Jack drove down the street, heading for downtown. After several minutes of driving,

Jack knew he couldn't hole up in this office and expect to survive. He needed to get out of the city, and quick. He picked up the shotgun and checked the chamber. He had at least 5 shots left. "I'll have to conserve the ammo until I can find more." Jack said to himself as he climbed back out the office window. He walked back down the stairs to the bar to find it was empty. "Guess those stiffs decided to pick on someone else." Jack thought to himself as he walked out of the bar and into the streets.

He was sunned at the damage that surrounded him. There were wrecked and abandoned vehicle crowding the streets. Numerous mangled bodies were strewn all over the pavement. Many of the surrounding buildings were either damaged or destroyed. "This looks like a warzone." Jack said to himself as he gripped his shotgun tightly. Jack spotted an abandoned taxi cab sitting just a few feet ahead of him. He recognized it as one of the taxi's that roamed the streets of the city. Jack remembered the times when he had to take a cab during the day. He approached the vehicle cautiously, his shotgun at the ready. Peering through the windows, he was relieved to find it was empty. He opened the drivers side door and slipped into the drivers seat.

The taxi had a small CB radio mounted on the dashboard. Jack managed to find the keys in the glove compartment. Turning the key in the ignition, the engine managed to start. "Thank god." Jack said to himself. Putting the taxi into gear, he drove off through the streets of the city, weaving in between wrecked or abandoned vehicles. After driving for several minutes,
112221.title: Grab a cab

1122211.content:
Jack decided to switch on the CB radio. Hopefully, he could make some use of it. He had started cycling through the frequencies when one caught his attention. "Citizens of Rustone. This is Major Alan Bernard of the US Army. We are broadcasting on this emergency frequency to alert any survivors of our position. We have set up a checkpoint on the Ortega highway 4 miles north of the city as well as at the Jameson motel 5 miles south of the city. We have food, water, and other supplies as well as first aid and have sent several teams into the city to look for survivors. If you come into contact with one of these teams please follow their instructions and do not brandish any weapons or aggressive behavior or you may be shot. If you cannot reach either of the checkpoints provided we advise you to stay in a secure location with no doors or windows if possible."

"Do not make any loud noise and turn off all lights and electricity. While the source of these creatures is unknown we do know that they can be attracted by noise and have at least some form of eyesight. While direct contact is believed to be nonfatal, these beings are extremely dangerous and all contact with them should be avoided at all costs. We wish good luck to you and your families. This message will repeat until the crisis situation is over. ... Citizens of Rustone, this is..." Jack let the message play a second time before switching the radio off. "So the Army's got places where I could be safe." Jack thought to himself "Now it's just a matter of getting there in one piece.". As Jack continued driving he decided to,
1122211.title: An emergency broadcast plays over the cabs CB r...

1122212.content:
Just as Jack turned a corner he saw a woman in a white dress run inside an old antique shop with broken front windows. His first instinct was to leave her but the fact that he was alone and there were few zombies on the street made him quickly reconsider his choice. After pulling up to the sidewalk and stepping out he noticed a wrench propped up against a mailbox and quickly grabbed it before setting his shotgun in the back seat of the cab.

"That chick in the dress looked unarmed so I should probably keep that in here so as not to spook her. I want a new ally, not an enemy." Jack mused as he walked in through the broken door and took a quick look around the shop. It was fairly small but had unbarred stairs leading to the second floor, likely where the woman had run off to. The downstairs were a complete mess of overturned shelves, tables and various trinkets but Jack made it to the second floor without much difficultly.

On the top of this floor was a single closed door on the other end of the room beyond some more shelves and tables and over near the left side was an opened window leading to a fire escape. Jack took a few seconds to think before deciding to look for the woman...
1122212.title: Lady in white

choices: Jack turns the music on and stays a bit longer...
1123.content:
Jack swore, he saw the ghost of Elvis that moment! The rotten bunch which had ganged-up on him in the Palace was still all eager to brawl'n'bite Jack to death. Yet something happened that moment. It felt like the Devil itself had re-spun the wheel of fortune. Zombies had hunger and dark magic on their side. Film heroes had guns to shoot zombies in the head. All Jack had before, was the chance for a most unwelcome gruesome death. Not anymore!

The wheel was turning and the dice were rolling. “Maybe the Reaper did send his sissies, yet now the God of gamblers has brought in me!” Jack thought to encourage himself.

He threw one more bottle into the face of one of the rotting punks encircling him. One swift scan through the room, so he an estimation of how long they would need to reach him. And then he faced the closest of the Bitches, the one which had tried to get behind the bar on its open side.

“Come here, Rotmouth! Daddy has some fine extra sugar for you, bitch!”

The Zombie seemed not impressed at all by those words. It was a notch more impressed by the brutal kick Jack unleashed into its stomach though. Before it crumbled in, Jack had already grabbed its head, given a face-smash upon the bar and a neck-break to finish it off.

Surviving Mini-Vegas, years on the streets and the boredom of all those hotel rooms had left plenty of time to see those martial arts workouts on TV and practice them, along with some housewife yoga, whenever Jack needed to make himself tired enough to sleep. Finally that waste of time proved itself to be an investment after all.

Two Zombies, obviously smart enough to cooperate jumped towards Jack. Jack spun around, quick steps backwards to make his next move. The World Wrestling Federation would have cheered in Jack's personal opinion!

Jack clawed the heads of the two jumpers and smacked them against each other as brutal as he could. Death-Defiance shining from his eyes and a logic-banning grin upon his lips. He knew it! The Zombies took a test-bite off each other, damn gluttons among cannibals.

Jack withdrew to the closest table, knowing time was running out. He turned a table upside down, kicked-free one of the table legs and readied his makeshift weapon. Smacky bash into rotten face one, even more smacking bash into rotten face two. Finally a stab through the eye of the first jumper driving forcefully into the brain.

Jack kicked another table-leg free. He had a plan now, one option out without being a walking corpse. Yet for now three more zombies were eager to get him. They never took time to mourn their losses.

The second former jumper lost his right eye when jack smashed his skull from the side. But the rotten punk did not rise up. Jack had no other choice at hand, he kicked one of the zombies' legs away and clobbered it down. Then he impaled its skull by driving the table-leg in with all the force he could muster.

The adrenal rush was fading off and jack felt exertion of his muscles and truth be mentioned, some fear. He would have given much to... No! He DID this to ever sit in a comfortable casino again and smile for knowing, that the best prostitute of the service awaited him in his hotel suite.

He readied the two remaining table legs and moved back, buying himself some time to breath. Bruce Lee and Chuck Norris, which meant the remaining two zombies, were too sure of their Shaolin Mumbo Jumbo. Neither the Jeet Kune do of Zombie one, nor the Karate of Zombie two made them immune to the brutal bashes of Jack's makeshift weapons.

“Come on Sissypussies, I will make you an offer which you cannot deny!” Jack had never worked so hard in his entire life. Taking out the zombies was the heaviest test of stamina and conviction which he ever had to pass.

When he had finally clobbered them down and when their heads were impaled, Jack checked each Zombie once more to be certain they pose no more threat!

It was time for a drink now and Jack made two handier bottles glide into his jacket. Whiskey on Ice was a heresy to some, yet in that moment Jack could have not cared any less.


Where will this story go next? Your choices are below...
1123.title: Readers Choice - Occam's Gamble & Crowley's Razor

Jack replied "I found it in one of the game booths.". "No offense." Lyle said "But you won't last five minutes with just that.". Jack hated to admit it, but he knew Lyle was right. He'd need some military grade hardware to survive this nightmare. "I'll tell you what." Lyle said as he took his duffel bag off.

That was when all the staff started turning into horrid monsters. It was by sheer luck that Jack had managed to survive.

He then looked at the wrecked or abandoned vehicles that had piled up on the highway or in the gas stations parking lot. He looked toward the city of Rustone in the distance. Even from far away, the city looked to be in pretty bad shape. There were columns of smoke rising in between buildings. Jack hated to admit it, but he'd have to head into the city.
