http://www.imfdb.org/images/c/cb/Mossber...

"This'll do better than the mop handle." Jack said, tossing the mop handle out of the window. He started the engine and drove off toward the city. After several minutes, Jack managed to reach the city and saw how serious things really were. Wrecked or abandoned cars littered the street, mangled bodies were strewn everywhere, and several buildings were seriously damaged. "This is worse than I thought." Jack thought as he continued driving through the deserted streets. Several minutes later,
11412.title: Find a working vehicle

choices: An emergency broadcast plays over the nearby radio
114122.content:
Jack spotted what looked like a gun store just ahead of him and pulled up to the curb. The store appeared to be mostly untouched. "Maybe I can salvage some supplies from the store." Jack said to himself "This shotgun will only take me so far,". Jack stepped out of his station wagon and approached the gun store, his shotgun at the ready. He kicked open the door to find the interior of the store was mostly empty. Jack walked up to the front counter and found an old radio that was switched on. It was playing some slow jazz music at the moment.

Jack started grabbing everything he could find on the shelves. He grabbed an AK-47, an Uzi, a couple of handguns and a hunting rifle. He also grabbed some extra ammunition from below the counter. He was stuffing everything into a duffel bag he found when,
114122.title: Jack reaches an abandoned gun store

1142.content: Jack decided to search the gas station for any supplies he could salvage. Holding his mop broom tightly, he began searching the station for anything useful. He gathered up several snack items from the shelves. "Most of what's in here has already been taken," Jack said to himself as he unwrapped a candy bar and took a bite out of it "I just hope I can find enough to survive this nightmare.". Jack soon came across the stations old rec room, and decided to search for something in there. Opening the door, he found the room had a large couch with a coffee table next to it, and a mangled corpse lay sprawled over a trashed flat screen TV. A large duffel bag sat on the coffee table. Setting his mop handle down, Jack sat on the couch and opened the duffel bag to find it was filled with,
1142.title: More Supplies

choices: Scour the abandoned vehicles for any extra supplies
11421.content: A big smile spread across Jacks face as he zipped the duffel bag open to find a large assortment of guns and ammo inside. "Looks like Christmas came early." Jack said to himself, chuckling. He the pulled out an Uzi and loaded a magazine into it. He then slung the duffel bag over his shoulder and walked out of the gas station. He found numerous wrecked or abandoned vehicles in front of the station and on the highway leading into the city. "I may need to head into town if I'm going to find some help." Jack thought to himself. He then decided to,
11421.title: Various weapons and ammunition

choices: Head to one of the evacuation points
114211.content: Jack decided that he'd better find a working vehicle if he wanted to be able to find help quickly. He searched among the wreckage on the highway for a decent vehicle he could use. He stumbled upon a beat up SUV sitting next to a wrecked school bus. Jack approached the SUV and searched the interior, finding it was empty. Pulling open the drivers side door, he slipped behind the wheel. The interior was a mess. There was blood caked all over the passenger seat and numerous pieces of trash were strewn all over the floor. Among the garbage, Jack had found a Map to the city. He noticed several areas of the city were circled in red and had the words "Evac point." written in the circles. "Looks like there must be a way out." Jack said to himself. He managed to find the keys in the glove compartment and was able to start the engine. He then started driving the SUV toward the city, weaving around wrecked or abandoned vehicles sitting on the highway. As Jack got closer, he was able to see the damage that undead monsters had actually caused. Numerous mangled bodies were strewn everywhere, many of the buildings had suffered extensive damage. "Who knows what these things can do." Jack though to himself as he cruised into the city. As he drove though the desolate city streets, he decided to,
114211.title: Search for a working car

choices: Another survivor tries to flag Jack down
1142112.content: Jack decided to try to find anyone who had survived whatever was happening. Even though he was desperate to survive this nightmare, he felt he should at least try to help someone else. He drove though the abandoned streets of Rustone, weaving in between wrecked vehicles and rubble from damaged buildings, his Uzi laying in his lap. He hoped he would be able to find someone that survived. After several minutes of driving,
1142112.title: Search for any survivors

choices: A horde of level 1 and 2 zombies appear
A group of Beasts jump out at him
115.content:
Jack had been drinking at the bar in one of Ruststones many hotels three days ago and wound up passing out. When he woke up, he'd been dumped somewhere on the outskirts of the city. He wandered for a at least 2 days. When he discovered the zombies he managed to flee to the Ravenhawk military base. There, he made his way to the armory. "Feels like Christmas morning." he said to himself. He then barricaded himself inside as hordes of the undead closed in. "Come and get me you assholes." he shouted while firing a M4A1 with M26 Modular Accessory Shotgun System at the door.

http://www.imfdb.org/w/images/9/98/PEO_M...

After a few hours, Jack managed to elimenate the horde. He packed several dozen magazines of ammo into his pockets. Then he crept out of the room and outside the main building. He managed to crawl through the base's outer gates, which were rusted through. Then he began walking back toward Ruststone. As he came across a suspension bridge that was choked with wrecked or abandoned vehicles,
115.title: War on the dead

choices: Try to walk past the back end of the bus
Try to knock the bus the rest of the way off the bridge
Try to make the long jump
1151.content:
The bridge looked sturdy enough, but getting past the wreckage would be a bit difficult with the gun in his hand. Still, Jack knew a safe bet when he saw it and quietly walked up with his new toy ready to fire. The place looked pretty bad with blood smears and broken glass everywhere, though it at least looked like a good number of people got away safely.

Up ahead was an abandoned cargo truck filled with snack cakes visible through the partially opened back door. Jack had found some rations and a little water back at the military base but knew he'd need food more than he needed extra ammo. After removing some of his spare bullets he stuffed some of the snack cakes into his pocket and climbed up onto the top of a nearby RV to get onto the roof of the truck.

Off in the distance he could see Ruststone further up the road as well as what appeared to be a wrecked military helicopter crashed at the foot of a small hill. While Jack was planning his escape back to the city something else caught his eye... movement near the front of the bridge. He walked over to the edge of the truck to get a better look but was horrified at what he saw.

A crashed city bus had suffered a nasty wreck that had sent the front end off the bridge and wedged the back end into what could only be described as a vehicle sandwich. This left Jack very little room to cross the bridge and get past the zombies that were now piling out of the crashed vehicles up ahead.

For a brief moment Jack considered turning back only to see the way he came now cut off by a large horde of zombies, several of which had been obscured by a large semi truck. "Shit, no way they won't see me if I go back that way." he cursed as he walked back to the front of the truck and jumped down onto the hood.

The traffic jam in front of him was bad enough that he might be able to just get across by hopping from roof to roof. "Here goes." Jack said confidently as he leaped from the hood of the truck onto a van and then to the side of an overturned truck much like the one he had just come from. In minutes he was just a few feet above a sea of zombies and about three fourths of the way across the bridge, the only obstacle left was the bus.

From the looks of things Jack had only 3 options: He could jump down and try to move past the end of the bus still on the bridge and climb up the vehicles to the other side, he could try to send the bus the rest of the way off the bridge or he could try to make the long jump from where he was standing and hope he'd be able to grab onto the bus and pull himself up.

None of the options seemed great but he was out of options at this point...
1151.title: Crossing the bridge

1152.content:
Jack heard a loud snarling and turned around to see a pair of grizzly bears charging toward him. Both of them were somehow turned into the undead monsters he'd been fighting off. Jack managed to shoot one of them down with his rifle. The second one tackled him, knocking his rifle out of his hands, and throwing him onto the ground. Then bear then threw himself onto him, attempting to tear him apart. Jack desperately fought against the monster. He managed to grab a hold of a sturdy piece of broken glass and jammed it into the bears eye socket. The bear quickly went limp and fell. Jack managed to push the bears corpse off of him and rose to his feat. He'd been pretty well scratched, but otherwise he was fine. He bent down and picked up his rifle and walked toward the bridge.

He could see that Rustone was just beyond the bridge. He hoped that someone had managed to survive the nightmare he was forced to fight in. Jack started walking in between the wrecked or abandoned vehicles. As he was making his way toward the opposite end of the bridge,
1152.title: A group of Beasts jump out at him

choices: An emergency broadcast come over the trucks radio
11521.content: Jack managed to find an abandoned pickup truck sitting in the middle of the bridge. Jack smiled with relief, feeling he'd be able to move more quickly with the truck than on foot. Jack stepped inside the cab of the truck and found the keys dangling on the rear view mirror. He put the keys in the ignition and managed to get the truck started. He then drove the truck out of the traffic jam and back onto the highway, heading toward Rustone. He'd been driving for several minutes when suddenly,
11521.title: He finds an abandoned vehicle

choices: Her room at the Oasis motel
In her car on the highway just outside the city
12.content: Very well. Where will Marie be starting?
12.title: Marie Lopez, a book keepers assistant

choices: They check the other rooms before heading downstairs
They head down the street towards a Walmart off in the distance
They head down the street towards a hospital off in the distance
121.content:
Tears ran down Marie Lopez's face as she looked out the window from behind the safety of tacky motel curtains. "T-there still out there..." She said weakly as she waited for her sister to come out of the bathroom, unsure if she could even hear her. As she looked around the outside world her eyes fell upon a grisly corpse. A fat bloated man was laying on the walkway next to the stairs. His head and entire body looked as if it had been ripped away, but that was NOTHING compared to the thousands of blood red ants moving in and out of the desecrated body. Marching all across the rails and carrying what looked like raw meat with them as they headed to their various destinations. Marie immedately turned away and threw up in disgust on the floor and part of the wall. "Hey, I thought I heard you throw up! You okay in there Marie?!" Her sister called as she began washing her hands. "Oh... Oh god..." Marie groaned as she struggled not to vomit a second time. "Are you okay, Marie?! Answer me!" Fransisca called out, with an agitated and more harsh tone to her voice. "I'm... I'm okay..." Marie groaned as she laid down on the bed and rested her head on the pillow.


She hated this. She and her sister were only passing through Rustone. They were only going to stay a little while. Now she and her sister were caught up in some kind of zombie apocolypse in the middle of nowhere. Marie buried her face in the pillow as she let out every emotion she had felt over the past three days. She wished she were with her father right now, she wished she were anywhere but here. They were supposed to arrive there yesterday, did their father know what had happened. Or their mother? Were they even still alive? The tears burned and stung Marie's rosy red face as she hugged the pillow for comfort. "Why... did... this... happen...?" She choked out through a sore throat. Her world had always been sunny and bright, even through the worst of times. Now she felt she would never feel warm sunlight again, even though the heat of the afternoon sun was slowly creeping over the small motel room.


"Well, we're out of tampons, I just used the last one." Fransisca said as she threw the empty box in the trash and opened the door to make sure her sister hadn't suffered a complete breakdown. "Are they... are they still out there?" She asked in a stern, yet worried tone. Marie simply nodded her head without looking up from the pillow. "Shit... its been three days then..." Fransisca noted as she sat down on the side of the bed. "Marie... you've got to stop crying. I know you're upset, hell, I want to fucking burn this whole city to the ground... but we're out of food, we're out of water, and, worst of all, out of goddamn tampons. We need to do something... its clear help isn't going to arrive... at least not before we're dead..." Marie's sobbing grew softer as she took large gasping breaths. "I... know... *sniff* But... But... what can we do...?" Fransisca put a hand on her younger sisters shoulder. "Looks like we'll have to go out there... and try to find help. If two teenage girls have survived this long by themselves there has got to be other people still alive out there. Maybe we can find them... maybe we can get out of this city and finally see dad..." Marie lifted her head off the pillow a little to look at her sister. "Daddy? You... you think he's still alive?" Fransisca nodded her head and smiled (a rare occurence for her) as she got up from the bed. "He married mom, so there's no way he's dead yet." Fransisca joked. "I don't think that old bastard would let himself die before her." Marie forced a weak smile as she rubbed her eyes. "Heh heh, you know you shouldn't talk like that..." Fransisca lost her smile and rolled her eyes. "Great, the zombies arn't bad enough. You're more worried about having a clean mouth."


"Well, what if we die? I don't want god to not let my sister into heaven because she doesn't act right." Marie said, her voice slowly returning to its normal sweet tone. Her sister merely groaned. "Please. If there was a god, why did he let this happen? Why didn't he protect us? Why didn't he stop d... You know what? Forget it. If clinging to the crap they taught you in church will help get us out of here go ahead and believe it. I'm going to be rational and think like a sane human being. C'mon... lets get out of here. " Marie wiped her eyes one last time and got off the bed. "O-okay, just let me grab one thing..." She said meekly as she picked up her purse off the table next to the bed and put a bible that had been sitting next to the lamp in it. "Don't tell me you're really gonna take that worn out old thing." Fransisca scoffed as she picked up her own purse. "Its not gonna help any." Marie was quiet for a few seconds before replying. "Maybe. Maybe it'll keep our spirts up... and its not like its gonna do any good sitting in this dusty old room..."


"Whatever, just don't starting chanting or some crap while we're sneaking by the zombies. You do that, I'll shove that damn thing up your ass." Fransisca taunted as she took a pack of cigarettes out of her purse along with a siver lighter with a stylized horse on it. "You don't have to believe in god like I do... But I wish you'd stop smoking..." Marie said as she zipped up her own purse. " Oh whatever. Its not likely I'll end up living long enough to get lung cancer or some shit. A good smoke is more important to me then a box of fresh tampons... and my packs only got 2 left." Fransica said as she lit her cigarette and inhaled its taste into her mouth. "Besides, you should be thankful. If I didn't have these to relax me I'd have probably killed you by now." Marie was the one to roll her eyes this time as she walked over to the door. "Just don't blow that stuff into my face... ready?" Fransisca picked up her knife off the table and got Marie one from the kitchen. "Yeah, lets head out, but first take this." She said as she handed her sister her knife. "And you use that if you have to... I know you don't like violence, but those ARN'T people out there..." Marie nodded and followed her sister out the door.
121.title: Sisterly love

1211.content:
The two girls decided to check the other rooms before heading downstairs. Unfotrunatly, most of the rooms either turned up empty of with a group of corpses laying on the floor. They eventually managed to make their way downstairs to the front lobby. There they found a large message scribbled in red paint above the fireplace.

"We have left a few small cashe of weapons, ammunition, maps and other supplies at the receptionist desk. If anyone has managed to find them, any survivors have taken refuge in any nearby churches. Whatever these horrid creatures are, they apparently cannot step onto the grounds of a church. We can only pray that whoever survives this nightmare will find safety. Godspeed."

-Andrew

"Well, at least someone was sensable enough to leave some thing for several other survivors." Fransisca said. The two checked the information desk and found several duffel bags suffed underneath, and each was filled with guns and ammunition. As Fransisca took an M16 assult rifle, Marie took a pair of Uzis out. Each started to load their weapons when
1211.title: They check the other rooms before heading downs...

choices: "We'll need medical supplies in case one of us gets hurt..."
1212.content:
"Let's hurry up and move pass these damn ants quickly, we don't need them crawling on us while we're trying to get up the road." Fransisca called out as she quickly moved down the walkway towards the other set of stairs. "What do you think happened to that poor man for him to end up like that?" Marie asked as she followed closely behind her sister. "I don't know and I don't fucking care. Let's just get out of here before one of his friends show up." Fransisca replied as she walked out onto the street. All around the two girls were torn halloween decorations hanging from street lights and buildings, adding a creepy atmosphere to the already nightmarish cityscape. "God, this whote place just feels... wrong, let's hurry up Marie." Fransisca said as she began walking down the street. "I can see a Walmart all the way at the end of this road, after we get some supplies there we can figure out what to do next."


The street leading to their destination went down a fairly steep slope, allowing them to better see the desvistation inflicted upon Rustone. There were even a few smoke clouds from fires rising in the distance deeper inside the city. It was all so much to take in that they barely noticed a police officer stumble out from behind an over turned car. "Oh thank goodness, mr. police man!" Marie called out, only to fall silent when she realized the person before her was no longer human. A soft groan escaped the mans lips as he raised his head and stared at the two living humans with pure hate in his glowing red eyes. "God damn it, Marie, he's one of them!" Fransisca called as she grabbed her sister by the arm and pulled her along past the rotting corpse. "Ah! My knife!" Marie called as the blade slipped out of her hand and fell near the dead officer's feet.


"Don't worry about it and just come on, he's a slow one." Fransisca said as she loosened her grip on her younger sister's hand. "We'll get you a new weapon at the store." The cop limped after them on a broken ankle and soon fell behind as the girls made it to the parking lot in front of the store. "You know, I used to hate how these things showed up everywhere... now I'm just glad we got a place to get all the stuff we need." Fransisca said as she flicked her cigarette on the sidewalk and stepped on it.
"We shouldn't split up if I don't have a weapon." Marie said as she walked over to the sliding doors and looked inside." The interrior looked dark and empty, but the soft sounds coming from inside ment that there were still zombies here. "Alright, good point." Fransisca noted. "Where do we go first then?"
1212.title: Maybe they'll have everyday low prices on ammo...

choices: They reach the hunting supplies section safely
They accidentally run into a zombie
12121.content:
"I think we should get some weapons to protect ourselves... Walmart sells guns, doesn't it?" Marie asked meekly as she heard one of the zombies inside stumble over a display of some sort, sending cans clanging to the floor. Fransisca raised an eyebrow at her sisters suggestion. "Really Marie? Thats not normally like you... actually wanting us to get some guns instead of trying to reason with the zombies." She said with a laugh. "You sure you're really my sister?" Marie let out a soft laugh as the two walked inside. "Well... we... we don't want to end up dead, right?" She replied as she tried to keep her mind off getting dismembered. "Damn right, I'm proud of you. Now, lets hurry up and grab some firearms before we come across any undead." Fransisca said as she began walking towards the front counter.


"Lets see... they usually have a map or something near the front." She said as the two began looking around at the various signs and pictures lining the walls near the service counter. "Oh, Fransisca! Over heres a map!" Marie called a bit louder than she intended. "Keep it down, Marie!" Fransisca muttered in a sharp tone. "They'll hear us if you make too much noise." Marie bowed her head a bit and replied that she was sorry, then pointed to a small piece of paper taped to a wall. It was a small map of the store with the fire exits marked with yellow circles from a sharpie marker. "Okay, good. On here its says that the hunting supplies are in the back next to the bathrooms, lets get going." Fransisca said as the two carefully navigated their way to the back through the darkened aisles.


The only illumination came from the sun peeking in through the front doors and a few small windows on the ceiling, giving just enough light to see by... and enough darkness to hide whatever may be lurking around the corner. "F-Fransisca?" Marie asked in a worried tone. "I'm... I'm a little scared..." Fransisca was quite unnerved herself, but tried to sound calm so her sister wouldn't panic. "I'm a little scared too Marie, hell, the whole world got pretty horrifying real fast, but don't worry. Soon we'll have guns to defend ourselves with, we'll make it out of here if we have to shoot everyone ourselves." Marie reached out and grabbed her sisters hand and held it tight as she turned around. "You... you promise?" She asked as she looked into her sisters eyes. "Yeah." Fransisca replied in her a confident tone. "I promise you you'll see mom and dad again as soon as we get out of here." Marie smiled as best she could and hugged her sister. "Thank you." She said softly as they continued making their way to the back of the store.
12121.title: The promise

choices: A small group of level 1 zombies
An old walkie-talkie lying on the floor
121211.content:
The two girls managed to reach the hunting supplies section without any trouble. Marie climbed over the counter and found a pair of Glock 17 handguns on one of the lower shelves.

http://www.imfdb.org/w/images/4/45/Glock...

Marie felt a tidal wave of relief wash over her as she took a handgun in each hand. She found several extra magazines of ammo in another drawer. Fransisca grabbed a large scoped hunting rifle, a pair of pistols, and plenty of ammo for each. "Now that we're armed, we'd better get some food and supplies, just in case." Fransisca said. Marie nodded in agreement. The two girls began to make their way through the Wallmart. After several minutes, the girls reached the electronics depeartment, where they found
121211.title: They reach the hunting supplies section safely

12122.content: Marie and Fransisca agreed to grab a few food items from the food section. They managed to make it there without any trouble. As Fransisca began to stuff her backpak full of bags of chips, fruits, and snack cakes, Marie started on some of the ice cream products. After a while they started off toward the hunting supplies area. As they were passing the electronics department
12122.title: "I want some food, I'm starving!"

121221.content: Suddenly, there was a clicking sound. "Don't move." a tense voice said. Marie and Fransisca both froze where they stood. They turned to see a man with blonde hair, brown eyes, a purple zippered sweater over a white T-shirt, and yellow kahaki shorts, holding a sawn off shotgun at them. "Who are you and what do you want here?" he asked in the same voice. The two girls looked at each other before Marie told them everything that happened. By the time Marie was finished, the man was still holding his shotgun at them. "So you're other survivors, right?" he asked. The girls nodded. The man finally lowered his shotgun. "What a relief." he said with a sigh. "I'm Trent by the way." he added, shaking each girls hand "So you were headed to LA, so was I, until this shit got started." he said. Trent then gave each girl an uzi with 3 extra clips each. As they made their way out of the Wal-Mart,
121221.title: They're found by another survivor

choices: She heads for the front gate and tries to find a way back into the city
She towards the Silverstone stadium and outdoor stage
She checks some of the nearby attractions for survivors and supplies
122.content:
Marie Lopez sat shivering in the matinence room under the roller coaster at Silverstone amusement park. The night air was thick with a cool breeze and the cries of the undead who were making their way through the park. It had been an entire day since she and her sister were seperated and Marie wasn't even sure if she was still alive. Her eyes were still red from all the crying she had done since she got here which had thankfully gone unnoticed by the zombies roaming the park outside. "We... we were just passing through..." Marie choked out as she tried to get ahold of herself. Her entire world had always been bright and full of sunshine, even when she was sad she knew things would get better so long as she had her family and her friends. Now she was alone in a strange place without either in the middle of the last thing she had ever wanted to experience. Her world had gone dark, her hopeful sunny demeaner had left her, and she had no way of knowing how she would even survive.


Her hand tightened on the crowbar she had picked up when she was still with her sister as Marie began singing softly to herself. "Jesus loves me... this I know... for the bible t-tells me so..." It was hard to hold back the fresh tears that were forming on the edges of her eyes, but she was starting to feel a bit braver as she went along. "Little ones to him belong... for they are w-weak, but he i-is strong..." She wiped her eyes as she stood up and looked out the window at the eeriely empty park. There were only a few weak zombies in sight, shambling along out in the open next to food stands and attractions. Marie felt an ice cold chill run down her spine even though she knew the bushes hid her quite well from the walking corpses. She still had trouble believing that this was all real, that something this horrible could really happen. "Its the end of days..." She moaned softly as she sunk back down to the floor. "I'm not getting out of here alive..."


For a brief moment Marie consitered the unthinkable, walking outside and just letting them have her. It would be quick and mostly painless... maybe she'd even get luckly and have one of them snap her neck. "Oh god... oh god no..." She whispered to herself as she came to her senses. "I... I can't just give up... I have to be strong..." She said with as much determination as she could muster. "I... have to find my sister..." She looked down at the crowbar in her hand with slightly blurred vision and took a deep breath. It was heavy, much heavier than she had expected a crowbar to be, but it would surely put an end to whatever she swung it against. The thought of killing anything repulsed her, yet she soon came to the grim realization that disposing of these things was a kindness. "Mercy." She whispered as she walked over to the door. "Peace for the dead. I have to do this... I have to be strong." With that, she opened the door and walked into the worst nightmare of her entire life...
122.title: The unhappiest place on earth

1221.content:
Marie managed to reach the front gate and pushed it aside, making a creaking noise that startled her. She looked into the parking lot to find a yellow 2003 Hummer H2 sitting nearby.

http://www.familycar.com/RoadTests/Humme...

She made her way toward the abandoned SUV. She found that the keys to the vehicle were taped to the one of the windshield. She also found a note taped to the drivers side door. Marie took the note and read it.

-To whoever finds this

I've stashed a lot of guns and ammo in the back seats of my truck. The gas tank is full and there are several spare gas tanks in the back seat as well. My mommy and daddy have been killed be the monsters and I'm afraid that I may not survive much longer without a grown up. I hope this will help whoever finds it.

-Godspeed.

Marie couldn't help but burst into tears at the fact that an innocent child had died hoping his belongings would help someone else. She bent her head down in a silent prayer. Then she got into the truck and drove out of the parking lot, back toward the city. She gasped at the devestated streets and buildings. After several minutes, Marie came across
1221.title: She heads for the front gate and tries to find ...

choices: Marie takes the stairs to the next floor
Marie heads back outside and trys to go somewhere else
1222.content:
The stadium was located right in the middle of Silverstone amusement park and often beconed to visitors from all over the park with its brillant light show and roaring music. Even with the power shut off and the fireworks put away the stadium was still easy to spot no matter where you were in the park. It seemed to call out to Marie, as if it was telling her she would be safe there, protected from the zombies crawling about the park restlessly. With her crowbar in hand Marie began walking past the dark, silent rides and darkened booths and snack tents. The only movement came from a chilly wind blowing the various decorations and torn streamers about like the branches of ruined trees. The effect disturbed Marie, but she remained brave and kept moving as she got closer to the stadium.


She almost screamed when a dead clown lumbered out from behind the food stand she was passing, the only thing that stopped her was the disgusting sound her crowbar made as it struck him upside the head. She covered her mouth as the body fell to the ground, a large chunk torn from its already mangled forehead. Fresh blood poured from the wound, mixing with the dried blood and make up on the ghouls face. Marie took a step back and fell to the ground after failing to steady herself. Tears began forming in her eyes as she dropped the crowbar to the ground with a light thud. "I'm s-sorry... I'm so sorry..." Marie choked out as she wiped her eyes on her shirt. She felt horrible, not just with the zombie she had just killed, but sick with fear at how close the thing had been to getting her. If she had been a second slower the large man would have likely pinned her... and that would have been it.


Marie picked up her crowbar and look up at the stadium walls under the starry night sky. She was much closer now, just a little bit further and she could hopefully rest. "I-I've got to be strong..." Marie said as she slowly stood up. "I can't give up now." She stepped over the body of the slain corpse and moved on. Soon she came to the glass doors of the stadium, which were strongly locked, but had been shattered with some type of blunt instrament, leaving a space just big enough for Marie to crawl inside. She swept away some of the broken glass with her foot and climbed through the small hole. The inside was very dark, but there was enough light coming in through the shattered doors to allow Marie to see some stairs leading to a higher floor, as well as the front desk. At one time it had been manned by a vendor who sold cheap curios and novelties at high prices, now it might have something worth scavenging... if there was even anything left...
1222.title: Come see the show...

choices: Keep moving down tha main hallway
12221.content:
Marie wasn't a big fan of the dark and knew she wouldn't get far without a light source of some kind. Luckily, that is exactly what she found underneath a pile of discarded t-shirts laying on the floor, along with a small pack of batteries and a note. It seemed to have been hastily scrawled out in ink with a few splotches here and there. It read:

Dammit, Johnson and Craig didn't make it back. I'm going out there. If I die and anyone finds this, we managed to barricade or seal off most of the stadium, but somehow they got in. Not many, but be careful if you go looking around. I've hidden a few supply catches all around the place, covered in park t-shirts or placed them next to souveners. Everyone else just uses an "R" symbol, think I heard em' say it stood for resupply. None of that nonsense here, you find anything next to a blue item go ahead and take it. But DO NOT touch anything near a red item or so help me god one of us will hunt you down ourselves. We might NEED those supplies... and we already had to kill Ann. Stay alert, stay focused, and for god's sake, stay away from the windows and doors.

- Saul

"Oh my god..." Marie whispered and she looked over the note again before putting it away. "Those things managed to get in, but there may be some more stuff here. I best look around... maybe I can even find a safe place to spend the night." She clicked the flashlight on and made her way over to the stairs. There were a few bloodstains on the wall and signs of a struggle, but no bodies meant the survivours who had fought here likely got away.


The second floor was a little worse off than the first, with a dead body covered in a blanket to greet Marie as she walked past a couple broken chairs and a ruined vending machine, the only remains of one of the barricades that had saved the survivours here from a quick death on the first day. As grim as the situation seemed, Marie still felt safer here than outside, where she would be easy prey for a group of these things. "At least in this creepy place I only have to worry about a couple dozen at a time instead of an entire horde... if there are even that many left." She said as she tightened her grip on her crowbar. Marie continued to walk down the vast empty hallway past a few restrooms, snack shops, and vending machines, careful to keep her eyes on any spot that something could leap out at her. Soon she came to a branched off hallway leading a little further towards the center of the stadium. At its end was a door leading outside to where Marie guessed the upstair seats were. Should she go and check out the view of the stage or stay inside and keep following the main hallway?
12221.title: Alone in the dark

After several minutes, she found the survivor, a man in an expensive buisness suit carrying a shotgun, was trapped at the top of the Star-Blaster, one of those drop-tower rides, with at least 3 level 1 zombies at the bottom. 125.content: Marie was trapped in one of the dressing rooms at Rustones well known Allen's water park. The entire place had a ski resort theme to it, with a ski lift that ran across the entire park. The park used to be a place where small children would frolick in the shallow waters. Now the park was a complete mess, as if hell itself had risen to Earth. The water that filled the pools and waterslides was tainted with the blood from countless corpses. Marie hid in one of the stalls, a butcher knife in her hands. "Why did this have to happen?" she asked herself tears streaming down her face "This place used to be so happy.". After several minutes, she finally decided her best chance of survival was to leave. She slowly made her way out of the dressing room and out into the kiddie pool area. She continued through the park until
125.title: Allen's water park

1251.title: She encounters a horde of level 1 zombies

choices: "Can I see the balcony overlooking the water park?"
1252.content:
Marie wanted to get out of this ghoulish water park as soon as she could, but more than anything else she wanted to find her sister. The two had been staying at a motel and Marie wanted to visit the water park before they left while her sister did not. The last time they had seen each other was now 3 days ago when Marie left the motel.

She was sure her sister was still alive since she was very smart and tough but couldn't shake the worry that something bad may have happened to her. They had been together their whole life and were there for each other during all of the bad times, like their parents divorce. Now she was all alone.

Marie stabbed a twitching corpse laying on the ground in the back of the head with her cleaver and wiped away the tears forming in her eyes. "I'm sorry. I'm sorry... I'm so sorry..." she repeated to herself as she started walking towards the front gate. Just as she was about to head out into the parking lot to grab her car a round from a hunting rifle dropped a level 2 zombie that had been rapidly approaching her from behind.

When Marie turned around she nearly screamed at the small horde of level 1 zombies that were closing in on her. "Hurry! Up here!" a man with a bandana wrapped around his head called out from the ski lift station overlooking the main pool. The zombies still approached but the sight of another human being gave Marie the courage to fend off her attackers.

As she ran for the station the man kept firing his hunting rifle and killing whatever zombies got too close. Marie even managed to take out a fat man in swimming trucks who attempted to ambush her her and sliced off his rotting jaw as she moved past him.

"C'mon, we need to get out of here!" the man called as Marie quickly ran up the stairs to the ski lift station and climbed over a small barricade he had set up near the top of the stairs. "Alright cutie, you follow my lead and I'll keep you alive." the man said as he prepared the lift to take them over the pool. "My name is Marie, it's nice to meet you." Marie said as she followed closely behind the man.

"We'll worry about introductions later, climb in, sit down and do exactly as I say." he replied as the lift carried them over the crimson waters of the pool below. "Normally, we'd jump in the pool and escape that way but these things already have the waters infested so we'll be riding up to the main station where my group is."

The ride over the pool was short and the two survivors were soon behind the safe walls of the heavily fortified main lift station. A single female survivor covered in tattoos and a pink bucket hat was there to greet them and help them off after their ordeal. "Hey Sasha, we got another live one here. I've gotta take the supplies I found to storage, can you explain things to her?" the man in the hat asked as he took a small backpack off and began walking towards the main room. "Sure, we were just about to have dinner and it'll be nice to have another woman with us.." Sasha replied as she reached out to shake Marie's hand.

"Hey there, welcome to our little resort group. That guy who brought you here is Blake, I'm Sasha and we have four other people in the main room who you'll meet in a minute. Their name's are Sid, Alex, Leo and Monique." Sasha said as she led Marie into the main room where four other people were lounging about.

One was a surfer looking guy in a wetsuit with goggles around his neck sitting on the floor reading a magazine, one was a fat guy sleeping in a chair, and the last two were a couple holding hands on a couch. The man wore a pair of glasses along with a plain white t-shirt and cargo shorts and the woman was still in her bikini, much like Marie herself.

The room itself looked like a ski lodge resort lobby and even had an authentic fireplace with several paintings hanging on the nearby walls. Aside from that were two couches and three chairs along with a table in the very center. Of all the places to be trapped during the end of the world this place really didn't look half bad.

"So, what do you want to do next on our little tour?" Sasha asked as Marie looked around. After taking a moment to think Marie answered with..
1252.title: New friends

13.title: Kenji Takashi, a martial arts instructer

131.content:
Kenji paused for a moment as the girl staggered closer, her mouth twisted in a sinister smile. "Forgive me for this life I take." Kenji wispered to himself as he gripped the hilt of his katana tighter. A bit of drool ran down the dead girl's mouth as her glowing red eyes focused on her would-be prey. With one swift motion the tip of the katana was dyed red and poking out of the girl's back. She let out a soft moan and collapsed to the ground as Kenji retracted the blade from her now destroyed heart. He wiped if off on his shirt and looked over the pile of corpses he had amassed over his brief stay here with sadness in his eyes. Outside the dojo was a trail of murdered zombies leading all the way back to his house. He wasn't sure exactly how many he had killed over the last three days, but he was sure the number was well over a hundred.


To him these walking dead were still people, they had loved ones, they had lives... and he had to kill them one by one in self defense. When they first showed up he had been walking home after a tiring day at the dojo teaching his class. He had though that old man that had bumped into him was only a drunkard... until he tried to rip the flesh from his bones with his teeth. A futile warning and a failed disabling strike later the man was on ground, coughing up blood from his crushed chest. Kenji would have reported himself to the police, but as he quickly found out... there were none left. After managing to reach his home he loaded up a bag of supplies and prepared to make his escape... the dojo was as far as he'd been able to get before he was forced to take shelter. He suffered from constant attack, though only from the weak undead that wandered in off the street. He had been able to dispatch them all effortlessly these past few days, but now he was starting to run low on supplies....
131.title: Rustones next top samurai

Then he set off of foot, his katana at the ready. As he continued walking through the eerie streets, he noticed there were a lot of buildings with structural damage. "Whatever caused this, I pray I managed to make it out alive." Kenji said to himself. After several minutes, he strode into the nearby suburbs. If anyone is still alive, may god see you on your way to safety.". Kenji bowed his head in silence for a moment before moving on. He moved to a nearby closet, where he found,

1312.content:
After making sure that the van's keys were in his pocket Kenji gathered up the supplies he had left and stepped out into the parking lot. There were a few zombies between him and the van and he had only one arm free to use his sword, but he had more than enough skill to easily cut down the level one zombies who attempted to hinder him. Four fresh bodies were sprawled out in the parking lot by the time Kenji made it to his van, all still bleeding from the devistating wounds inflicted upon them. "I can't wait to get out of this city... even if hell itself is where I have to escape to." Kenji said grimly as he sat the supplies on the floor of the van and pulled the door shut before a limping dog managed to get in. A soft rain began pouring as Kenji pulled out onto the empty streets of Rustone.


For the better part of an hour Kenji simply drove around looking for a place he could salvage some supplies, only to see large crowds of zombies near any major store he came across. Even many of the smaller stores and shops had too many zombies for him to deal with only a katana. "Everywhere, they infest this this place from the inside out... I need to get away from the center of the city..." Kenji said as he made a turn onto the main road heading north. He didn't know the layout of the city very well, although he knew where all the major locations were. "If I can make it out of the city I'll be able to get enough gas at the station out on the highway to make it to Vegas, if it hasn't met the same fate as Rustone..." Kenji thought to himself as he looked out his windows at the devistation that had occured after the last 3 days. "But before I do that I'll need to atleast stock up on water in case this piece of junk breaks down out in the desurt."


At that moment, as if on cue, the aged vehicle sputtered and began slowing down. "What?! No! I'm sorry, just please don't give out just yet!" The van made it to the next intersection before it finally came to a stop. "C'mon... c'mon... damn it!" Kenji cursed as he stepped on the gas pedal to no effect. He was stranded with only his katana near the center of a city slowly overflowing with the undead. For the first time in his life he felt truly fearful that he may not make it out of this alive. He was just about to step outside and continue on foot when he noticed something he had overlooked before. The van had simply run out of gas as evidenced by the flashing light on the fuel gauge. "That's right... I was going to get gas the next day, but then all this happened..." He said as he turned away and got out onto the empty road. After a quick look around Kenji realized he was on Clark street, which ment a gas station was less than a mile to the south. Of course, there was also an arcade nearby and the suburbs of Rustone were only a mile or so to the west. Seems Kenji has a rather important descision to make...

Kenji heard a noise behind him and grabbed his katana, fear coursing through him, ready to strike the threat. But the fear started to ease away when he realized the figure wasn't a zombie. "It's another survivor." Kenji whispered to himself. It was a teenage boy with blue eyes, brown hair, wearing a red T-shirt, green khaki pants, and carrying an automatic shotgun. "You OK?" Kenji said, catching the boys attention. It would be impossible to tell which face showed more relief. "My name's Chris." the boy said. "Kenji." he replied, shaking his hand. "Need a ride out of this hellhole." he asked, laughing slightly. "What do you think?" Chris asked in mock puzzlement. Chris managed to help Kenji finish refueling the van. He then gave him one of his guns, a Glock 17 handgun.

13122.content:
Somehow Kenji felt himself drawn to the arcade, maybe because he had spent his fair share of quarters here as a kid. Unlike many of the other kids his age he had struggled to beat even the first level of most of the games there, though he always had fun playing. "Heh, I wonder if they still have Ms. Pac Man or Dig Dug?" He said with a laugh as he stepped into the dimly lit room filled with glowing machines waiting for children to come in and play them. If not for the zombies walking the streets outside, it would have been just like any other day. Kenji walked towards the counter near the back without even noticing the blood smeared over the front of a pinball machine over next to the vending and change machines. "Hello? Hello, is anyone here...?" He asked as he looked around the shadowy room. Silence.


"Damn it, why did I even bother coming in here? This is no time for nostalgia." Kenji muttered as he hopped over the counter. "Hopefully, there's at least something here that can help me..." Many of the shelves below the counter were empty or contained boxes of stuffed prizes for the crane machine. There was a handgun laying on the floor under an overturned box, but it was empty and the clip was missing. Nothing else of vaule could be found. "Nothing." Kenji groaned as he kicked one of the boxes. "Should I try the back room? I've already wasted enough time here... maybe I should just go." His desire to leave was strong... yet he couldn't shake the feeling that something else might be found in the back room...

He was in a small hallway that split off in three directions. To his left was a door next to a large glass window, clearly an office. To his right was a door that Kenji assumed led to a storage room of some kind. Lastly, at the end of the hallway was a door that must lead back outside. "Looks like I got 2 choices..." Kenji said as he opened the door to the office. "Lets see what is in here first..." One eye was open in shock and the other had a pair of sissors jammed into it pretty deep. The ghouls entire face was covered in a dried and cracking layer of blood.

He didn't smoke, but the cigars looked expensive and would likely be a good item to trade if he found other survivours. As for the notepad, it could be a big help for keeping track of important imformation. Kenji roamed the abandoned streets of Rustone for several minutes until he spotted what looked like an abandoned military Humvee sitting in the street a few yards ahead of him. He rushed toward it, gripping his pistol tightly. He stopped when he saw a zombie dressed in army fatigues pinned down beneath one of the wheels. The zombie growled and reached out, but was unable to grab him. Kenji felt his heart sink and he thought about what kind of terror this man must have endured before this. "I can't even begin to imagine what sort of horror you've been though." Kenji said, kneeling down to look at the zombie blood stained face "You fought bravely against these monsters. I hope that your teammates have managed to escape or stay alive.". The zombie growled in response as he continued to reach for him.

Kenji sighed as he looked at his pistol. "You don't deserve to suffer like this." Kenji said. He put his pistol to the zombies face. "I hope you'll be able to find peace.". With that, he pulled the trigger, sending a round through it's face. The zombie immediately went limp and fell to the pavement. Kenji sighed and bowed his head in silence for several minutes. Then he rose to his feet and started searching through the Humvee for anything useful. After several minutes of searching,

Kenji then started the SUV and trundled out of the gas station and into the empty streets of Rustone. As Kenji continued driving, his heart sank as he saw more destruction among the city. The level 2 zombie fell to the ground with a light thud as its two level 1 buddies lumbered towards Kenji as they groaned in anger. Both were laying on the sidewalk dead before they even knew what hit them. "That was only the second group I've come across since I left the van." Kenji said as he wiped the blood from the blade. "Most of them seem to haved moved on... probably because everyone here is already dead..." A cool breeze picked up as Kenji continued down the street desperately looking for any signs of life. Sadly, the only things he saw moving were the few level ones that still remained here, yet he kept moving in the hopes someone was still around to help him. He passed by a yard sale where a man was laying face down in a small plastic swimming pool that had been stained with his blood. One of his legs was missing and nowhere in sight... at least Kenji wouldn't have to worry about him coming back to attack him.


After making sure the other zombies were still a good distance away he took a few moments to sort through some of the boxes and tables in search of something he could use. He said as he turned to move on... only to stop dead in his tracks as a bullet impacted the house behind him, missing his head by only about a foot. "What the...?" Kenji gasped as feeling quickly returned to his feet. Another bullet struck the table as he began sprinting towards the next house, which had its front door torn off the hinges. "Shit! I'm not going to make it...!" He shouted as yet another bullet pierced the mailbox in front of him. 13131.content: Kenji saw a man standing just outside the front door. He felt relief wash through him when he realized it wasn't a zombie. The man was about his age, was bald, had a small goatee, and was wearing a black sweatshirt, a blue pair of jeans, and a pair of green sneakers. He held a sawn off shotgun, a large duffel bag hung from his shoulder a large backpack rested on his back. Kenji pushed aside the table blocking the door aside, unlocked the door, and stepped outside cautiously. The man noticed him and raised his shotgun, but lowered it when he saw Kenji was safe. "Seems like someone's still alive." Kenji said. "Yeah." the man said gruffly "It sure is nice to see a face that doesn't gave red eyes or shredded skin for once.". "That's for sure." Kenji replied "You welcome to stay here if you like." Kenji added. "Thanks." the man said as he walked up toward him. "Name's Ray, by the way." he said, holding out his hand. "Kenji." Kenji replied, shaking his hand. Kenji then led Ray back into the dojo and replacing the barricade. "If you don't mind me asking, why do you have a duffel bag and a backpack?" Kenji asked. "The duffel bag holds my weapons, the backpack holds food, water, med supplies, etc." Ray replied, setting his bags of the floor. As Ray started to get settled in, Kenji decided to,

There were wrecked or abandoned vehicles scattered here and there on the streets, there were several mangled corpses laying on the sidewalks, several nearby buildings had some serious structural damage. "I doubt that there are many people left after this disaster. But I pray that some were able to survive this nightmare." 133.content:
Kenji shoved aside a large bloody man wearing swimming trunks as he made his way downstairs from the top floor of the Master's Ace casino and bar. The man hardly let out a groan as he slowly got back to his feet and began shuffling down the stairs after the much faster human. "Blast, three days here and they're still gathering around the doors... I should have left when they were only a few in front of the building." Kenji muttered under his breath as he hid behind a row of slot machines to avoid dectetion by the large horde surrounding the broken front doors. They were only a few level one zombies aimlessly walking about the casino with the bulk near the main exit, this ment Kenji was safe from danger but would have to get them to move if he wanted his freedom. "I ran out of water last night and I can't just drink alcohol..." He said softly as he crept a bit closer to his goal. "I'll have to get them away from those doors or I'll die in here before help can arrive." He didn't have any weapons other than his own two fists, which meant he would have to take his chances in the street until he found a better means of self defence... if he ever managed to get out of here alive.


"They listened to the sounds made by the machines when they were played the other day, maybe if I can set off a jackpot they'll come over to investigate it." He noted as he ducked beneath a blackjack table. "I'm not very lucky... heck I can't even win at video games, but I have to hope fate is on my side for this." He said a short prayer and silently moved over to a large machine that payed out a $50,000 top prize. He was fairly exposed here, but the distance and the long line of exotic potted plants helped obscure him from view. "I just hope this works." He said as he sat the purse full of money he had collected on the floor and began playing the slots. After a few minutes the noise alerted a few zombies to his position and they began slowly searching for a way to get to him. "No... c'mon I'm almost there, just a few more times... c'mon c'mon..." He chanted as an obese woman lumbered her way around the corner and began walking up a short set of steps that would take her to Kenji. "7...7... Bar! Damn it! That was so close!" He cursed under his breath as he pulled the machines lever again... not noticing that the woman was now joined by a security officer and middle aged tourist...
133.title: Win big!

choices: Kenji decides to enter the park

1332.content:
"Damn..." Kenji groaned as he stepped away from the machine to engage the approaching zombies. He triped the woman with a foot sweep and crushed her head with a stomp as he delivered a blow that knocked the security guard backwards. The man's ribs cracked as he stumbled into the tourist and both fell back down the stairs. "So much for them... now I've got to hurry up and set off this jackpot, I don't have much money left..." With that Kenji quickly made his way back over to the machine as the other zombies began to investigate the noise coming from the two injured ones wiggling about on the bottom of the steps. "No... hurry... hurry..." Kenji whispered as he softly banged his fist on the machine. Another failure. Kenji was just about to take another spin when he noticed that more of the zombies were approaching the stairs... more than he could deal with by himself. "No, this might be my last chance... please..." Kenji begged as he turned the lever one last time and ran back around in the direction he had come from.


If the machine hit a jackpot he might be able to get outside, but if it didn't he'd have to retreat back upstairs for now. Kenji held his breath as he prepared to run for either the front doors or the stairs to the second floor. A loud ringing sound echoed as lights flashed and coins started erupting from a large slot on the massive machine. Kenji had triggered the $5000 prize. "Yes! Thank you..." Kenji whispered as the horde continued to lumber towards the loud distraction. When only a few stragglers remained Kenji made a mad dash for the exit, shoving aside the few remaining undead that got in his way. One last fat man tried to block off the door and grab Kenji, but the young martial artist was too quick for the shambling corpse. Once outside he began running down the road away from his temporary prison as fast as he could. Finally, he came across Paradise Park, Rustones biggest and most beautiful outdoor park, at the end of the street.
1332.title: Won big... kinda...

13321.content:
"This... is definately not good..." Kenji muttered as he gazed upon the blood smeared along the outer wall. "The whole city seems dead... did they wipe everyone else out? No... no! I can't think like that! If there is anyone left I must help them, together we can hopefully reach safety outside this accursed city..." The words had barely left Kenji's lips before a wave of dread washed over him. What if he WAS the last man alive in the city... or the entire planet? It would be hard to keep his mind off such things, but if noting else Kenji had learned to focus and be patient. He took a deep breath and headed into the park. A large tattered and bloodstained banner reading "Rustone would like to wish everyone a very HAPPY HALLOWEEN!" in black and orange letters was torn down and stretched all the way into the road. Not the best sign, but better than seeing a mound of corpses piled near the entrance.


The park was actually a pretty good place to hide for it was quite wide and open, but with several excellent places to hide. As he walked along on the path leading to the fountain in the center of the park Kenji almost forgot that he had just narrowly escaped a zombiefied casino. The warm sunlight, fresh air, and lush green surroundings certainly helped take the edge off, but it almost made Kenji nervious with its desolate emptiness. Several barbecues and picnic areas were completely abandoned, save for the occasional mangled corpse or lucky animal that had so far managed to escape death at the hands of the terrors walking through the rest of the city. "This place looks almost untouched..." Kenji said to himself as he looked over the isolated bits of carnage. "Guess most of the people here were able to get away in time... thankfully..."


It wasn't much, but the signs that suggested at least some people got away kept Kenji's spirit up... until he made it to the fountain. Paradise park had always been beautiful, but its crown jewel was definately its large wishing fountain in the center square. Three elegant stone mermaids were captured in a scene of playful frolicing with various forms of sea life as streams of water twirled around them. It was a sharp contrast to the brutal display under it. Shimmering crimson water filled the base of the fountain, obscuring the many coins carelessly tossed into it by carefree children and their parents. Propped up along its outer sides were a little over a dozen body bags, some closed tight, some ripped open, and some much smaller than the rest. A few other corpses were simply covered in blankets and sheets, but all had flowers and various other offerings placed near them. A football helmet, a pair of sunglasses, a family photo... a teddy bear...


Kenji simply stared in silence at the gruesome memorial. These people who had moved on had no time to bury their dead... this was the best they had been able to do. Kenji covered his his mouth as he felt tears begining to well up in his eyes. He knew things had gotten bad, but had hoped he wouldn't find something like this. The smell from the decaying bodies stung his nose, but he found he couldn't turn away. Finally, his eyes fell upon a message spray-painted on the side of a clear space:

Marvin Briggs
Kyle Doyle
Sarah Doyle
Mike Doyle
Desmond McGuiness
Leroy Young
Fred Young
Vee Grooms
Ted Clarke
Elizabeth Clarke
Ed Taylor
Ed Taylor Jr
Lenny Regan
Samuel "Brick" Rhodes
Kinzie "Phonex" Usher
Dan Gray
Fran Wellington
Stacy Wellington
Jan Wellington
Ellen Frost

May all these lost souls find peace.

If anyone comes across their final resting place we have moved on towards the northern edge of the city. When we have enough people we plan to escape to Vegas. We have left some emergency supplies in the chest near the parks restrooms, which are located up the hill from this location. May god help us all.

Kenji took a moment to re-read the message and bowed his head in a moment of silence for those lost. Afterwards he took a brief moment to rest and pay his respects to the people who had died here. He wasn't sure if there was anything worth finding at the restrooms, but it wasn't too far from here... and he certainly had plenty of time... not a single zombie in sight...

The other had sleek black hair, was wearing an expensive suit and carried a double-barreled shotgun. Both aimed their guns at him, and he responded by taking aim with his M4. He knew that the police station was there and with luck, he might be able to get to the police armory and maybe some radios to call for help. He hoped there would be some way to escape. As Kenji walked amongst the devastation that littered the streets, he came upon the mangled corpse of a police SWAT officer. The mans throat had been viciously slashed and his face was almost completely torn off. Laying next to the mans body was a Beretta 92FS handgun.

Several of the bases soilders had been infected. Soon, it had spread to who knows where. Kenji managed to hide himself in a broom closet, holding a Glock 36 pistol that he found off a dead guard.

http://www.imfdb.org/w/images/5/5f/G39.j...

He also had 2 spare magazines of ammo. He decided he'd best get out if he wanted to survive this nightmare. He slowly made his way out of the closet and though the hallways of the base. "If any of those sons of bitches come near me, they die." Kenji said to himself. After several minutes, he came across
134.title: The abandoned Ravenhawk military base just outs...

He was able to barricade himself in the gift shop. Though he was pleased he'd survived this long, he knew he couldn't stay here. Luckily, he'd found a gun and some extra ammo off of one of the aquariums dead security guards. Kenji finally decided he needed to get out. As he exited the gift shop, he made his way toward
135.title: The Rustone aquarium

1351.content: Normally, Kenji would've been excited to see the dolphin exhibit. Not today. Instead of playful dolphins swimming in clear blue water, all that was left was a tank full of blood red water and dolphin corpses. The few baby dolphins that were left had been zombified. Suddenly,
1351.title: The dolphin exhibit

He heads across the parking lot towards a large bus parked near the wall

1352.content:
Kenji had been to this place twice before, the first time being a special treat for being such a good boy during his familys long move to America. He remembered that a killer whale was one of the first things he saw after walking inside so he began following the signs towards that exibit in the hopes that he'd soon be out of here. The lights had been out since the first day, but a few people who had been through hung up small lights and glow in the dark objects to help lead people to the exits. The bright sunlight shining in through the bloodied water was the only other source of illumination and dyed many of the halls an eerie shade of blood red. Dank and smelly water splashed under Kenji's shoes as he began walking down a hallway with a busted window.


In the near darkness he could make out several pairs of glowing red dots flopping about. Most of the sea life contained here had long since died, but a few had become miniture zombies. They were completely harmless, but still unnerved Kenji. This place had been a happy memory from his childhood up until a few days ago, now it was filled with corpses both large and small and smelled strongly of decaying flesh. Kenji put a hand to his nose as he passed a large carcass that looked like half a manatee with its entrails strung out near the many shards of broken glass. He then turned down a new hallway and was overjoyed to see a faint trail of light pouring in from a couple windows overlooking the barricaded doors leading outside. He moved along quickly before a noise made him stop dead in his tracks.


Out of the corner of his eye he had caught something swim closer to him from the murky red tank surrounding this part of the hall. It was an undead killer whale. At first it looked unharmed, but when it passed by Kenji caught a glimpse of a deep gash running across the creatures back and tail. It had been attacked by something and was now undead itself. "Oh no, it spotted me!" Kenji shouted as he ran out of the way of the monsters violent charge. The sound of shattering glass echoed throughout the building and was quickly drowned out by the thundering rush of water that began flooding the large hall. Kenji fired two shots at the Beast in a panic as he began sprinting for the exit. The killer whale let out a mighty growl as it tried in vain to swim over to the young martal artist. Had Kenji been a second slower he may have ended up bitten in half or crushed, but the warm sunlight that washed over him as he began to take down the barricade over the doors told him he had made it... for now. After removing the last object blocking the door Kenji walked out into the large parking lot and continued on in his fight for survival...
1352.title: Cold water and warm sunlight

13521.title: He checks a few of the cars for supplies before...

13522.title: He heads across the parking lot towards a large...

Then he heard a voice come from the helicopter. "If anyone can hear this, proceed to the High Rollers Casino for evacuation." the voice said "Repeat. Proceed to High Rollers Casino for evacuaton.". Hope then started to spread through Kenji. "If a can get to that casino, I can get out of here." he said to himself as he jumped out of the truckbed and started to make his way toward th casino, which was about a mile east from the aquarium. He walked in and out of the wrecked or abandoned vehicles that littered the streets. After several minutes,
135231.title: A helicopter soars overhead

1353.content:
Kenji made his way to the parking lot in front of the building. Keeping his gun at the ready, he looked at the all the abandoned or wrecked vehicles in the lot, making it look much like a graveyard. Kenji then spotted a white 2010 Chevy Suburban sitting across from him.

http://static.cargurus.com/images/site/2...

A large RS was written on one of the doors. Excitement running through him, Kenji ran toward the Suburban. Reaching it, he was relieved to find the doors were unlocked. He also found the keys in the glove compartment. Kenji also found a duffel bag full of guns and ammunition in the back seat of the Suburban. Kenji slipped a fresh magazine into his gun and took a SIG-Saur P226 handgun out of the duffel bag and slipped it into his belt.

http://www.imfdb.org/images/e/e3/SigP226...

Slipping behind the wheel of the SUV, Kenji drove out of the parking lot and onto the streets of Rustone. Kenji looked in at the streets in shock. There were abandoned or wrecked cars were strewn about the streets, large structures had been heavily damaged, and mangles corpses littered the streets. "I pray that there are others who have survived this nightmare." Kenji said to himself. As he started to drive along the Rustone Strip, which sported the city's best casinos, hotels and strip clubs, Kenji came across,
1353.title: The parking lot

13532.content: Kenji soon drove into the parking lot that belonged to one of the city's numerous grocery stores. Kenji spotted a large hole in the front entrance of the store. A large bus had smashed through the front doors, creating a hole big enough for Kenji to park his SUV in. Kenji then stepped out of his vehicle and looked around. There were far less mutilated bodies in the store, but the smell was overwhelming, almost causing him to throw up. "I'd better gather some food and water, in case I get stranded or find any survivors." Kenji said to himself. Kenji then took out his two handguns and walked deeper into the store, heading for,
13532.title: An abaondoned grocery store

135321.content: Kenji stopped at the section of the store where all the drinks were kept. He picked up several bottles of Pepsi and Mountain Dew. He also grabbed several bottles of water. Finally, he grabbed a few bottles of vodka and whisky, which he planned to save until he was out of the city. After storing all the drinks in the back of his SUV, he then went back into the store. He was looking for any snack foods that had been left behind when he came across,
135321.title: The drinks section

1353211.content:
Kenji had just turned around a corner when he came face to face with another man. He had bright blue eyes, scruffy black hair, and a well built body. He was wearing an oversized combat jacket, a white tank top, a pair of denim jeans, a pair of black dress shoes, and was wielding an AK-47. You jumped back and fell to the floor, your guns raised. The man raised his rifle as well. "Who are you?" the man shouted, clearly terrified. "I'm not looking for any trouble." Kenji said, keeping his voice steady and calm "I'm just another survivor, OK.". The man started to show a huge amount of relief as he lowered his rifle and helped Kenji to his feet. "You OK." the man said. "I've been better." Kenji said, dusting himself off "What about you?". "Been searching for a way out of this hell hole." the man said, clearly showing signs of fear. "Looks like you're in luck." Kenji said "I had just stopped to fill my SUV with supplies. You feel like tagging along.".

The man thought for a few minutes before saying "I guess it's better than dying alone out here." he said. "My name is Kenji Takashi." Kenji said, extending his hand. "I'm Mike." the man said, shaking it vigorously. "Let me grab a few snack items and then we can go." Kenji said. After gathering an armful of candy bars, snack cakes and boxed cookies, Kenji and Mike walked back to the SUV. Kenji placed all the food in the back seat with the drinks. Mike slipped in the passenger seat. Kenji slipped behind the wheel and drove out of the grocery store and onto city streets. After driving through the deserted downtown area, Kenji decided to,
1353211.title: Another survivor

choices: Head for the southern part of the city, where there may be more survivors
135322.content: Kenji hadn't thought about it much, but he was starving since the outbreak started. He went to the snack food aisle of the store. He was surprised to find the shelves were still half full with various snack items. "I expected the store to be empty." Kenji thought to himself, smiling "I guess luck is on my side.". Kenji grabbed several Snickers bars and put them in his pockets. He then took a Hershey's candy and took a bite out of it, relieved to eat something after several days of running. He then grabbed a stray shopping basket and filled it with other candy items. He then took what he found and placed it in the back seat of the SUV. Climbing back into the SUV, Kenji drove back onto the streets of Rustone. As he cruised among the devastation that surrounded him, he decided to,
135322.title: The snack food section
