14.title: Jessie Tenenbaum, a conspiracy theorist

choices: She cuts a path to her car and drives the hell out of there
She cuts a path to the street and makes a break for one of the houses
She cuts a path to the street and starts running down it towards the next street
141.content:
It was a warm October afternoon in Rustone's suburbs and normally it would be filled with the sights of people enjoying the fresh air and beautiful weather. But, as fate would have it, Halloween had come much earlier this year and the streets were already filled with ghoulish mosters looking for their candy. Most of the picture-esque homes and yards were covered in fresh blood, organs, and moaning zombies. The nightmarish decorations of hell placed upon an unsuspecting nighborhood. Yet, amazingly, there was a house untouched by the undead... although the lawn was still a mess of corpses. Jessie Tenenbaum fired her 12 gauge into the torso of a man in a business suit and blew away half of his mangled face. "I DON'T WANT ANY!" She roared as she loaded 2 more shells into the shotguns chamber and opened fired on a group of zombiefied girl scouts making their way up her driveway. "KEEP YOUR GOD DAMN COOKIES!"


The ghastly little horrors went down easily, but there were still many more coming from off the streets. "BURN IN HELL YOU MOTHERFUCKING ABOMINATIONS!!!" Jessie yelled as she threw a homemade molotov into the middle of a corpse pile on her front lawn. Several shambling undead burst into flame instantly as she grabbed another firebomb and hurled it at a large man in a football jersey and "kiss the cook" apron. "KISS THIS, YOU ASSHOLES! YOU'RE RUINING MY YARD!" The zombies just kept coming and she kept putting them back down with all the hellish fury of a demon. Then, the unthinkable happened... she ran out of molotov's and her shotgun clicked on an empty chamber. "SHIT! WELL THEN, COME AND GET SOME YOU WALKING HORRORS!" She called as she picked up the two machetes she was keeping next to her porch chair and began slicing her way to safety. One zombie at a time.
141.title: STAY THE FUCK OFF MY LAWN!

choices: She heads deeper into the city to search for a way to call for help
She heads away from the city to try and escape
She tries to gather a few supplies and reclaim her home
1411.content:
Blood flew through the air like streamers and confetti as Jessie hacked through the horrors as if they were made of paper. "I don't have a fuckin' clue what the government has done now, but I swear that this isn't going to be the end of me! COME AND GET SOME YOU WALKING MEAT CHUNKS!" Jessie shouted over the moans of the undead as she dropped a machete to grab a nearby man by the throat and slam him facefirst into the side of her car. Quickly, she threw the body into another zombie and climbed inside before they could grab her. "GET THE HELL OUT OF MY WAY!" She shouted as they began to surround her. "FINE, HAVE IT YOUR WAY THEN!" Without even bothering to fasten her seat belt she hit the gas and ran two zombies over as she pulled out onto the street.


Not content to simply escape with her life, Jessie then backed up into the growing crowd, knocking several of them off their feet. The last thing she did before hitting the gas a second time was to pull out the uzi she kept hidden under the front seat and unload it into the fiends that had driven her from her house. Several fell, all the rest simply began dripping blood as they tried to close in on her again. Of course, Jessie was already on the next street by the time they had even made it 2 yards closer to her. "Jesus, I can't believe I let those bastards make me run like this. I should go back there and kill them all..." Fortunately, her common sense outweighed her rage and she didn't even look back. She drove around for a few minutes to look for other survivors in the surrounding nighborhoods, but it soon became clear that everyone else had either abandoned the suburbs or died trying... Luckily, Jessie was the type of woman to always have a plan, even if it wasn't always a good one...
1411.title: Road rage

choices: Jessie takes a few minutes before moving on
Jessie starts up her car and drives off before more zombies come along
14111.content:
Jessie tried to focus as she grabbed a bottle of pills from on top of the dashboard and poured a few into her hand. "Good thing I just got my perscription filled the other day, god knows what I'd do otherwise." She said softly as she slowed down a bit while turning around a corner. "But these are just my anti-depressants. I left all my other medications back at the house... I'll have to pay a visit to the pharmacy once I contact some help." Jessie was careful to keep her eyes on the road as she slowly made her way deeper into the city, taking note of the destruction around her. "My god... what the hell happened to this place...?" She thought to herself as she gazed out her left window at a store that was completely missing its front wall as well as a good portion of the ceiling.


"There's no way those slow zombies did that... I knew there were stronger ones, but I wasn't expecting some kind of fucking juggernaut. There's no way the ones I saw at my house could do something like this." Jessie paused for a moment to reload her uzi and drove away, making sure whatever had wrecked the store wasn't following her. As she made her way deeper into the city things began looking worse and worse. Dead bodies were strewn about everywhere... and more than a couple were up and walking. "Dammit, this isn't good!" Jessie shouted as she pulled over to the side of the road.
14111.title: A city in ruins

choices: Forget it, she's zombie chow, head straight to the police station
141111.content:
After taking a few minutes to rest and plan her next course of action Jessie pulled away, crushing a few of the zombies beneath the front of her car. "The police station should have something I can use to contact the outside world, a broadcast relay or something." Jessie said to reassure herself. "Its probably broken by now, but I should be able to figure something out. If nothing else, they should have plenty of weapons there for me to use." The station wasn't too far from where Jessie lived, but was still a decent ways away. The only good thing about heading towards it was that the number of cars were lower, making it easier to drive around wrecks and blockades. Of course, this also ment less cover to hide behind should she become stranded.


It wasn't long before Jessie was turning around the corner onto the street that led directly to the station... only to come aross three wrecked cars that made it impossible to proceed unless she got out and continued on foot or went around another way. "Oh fuck me... of course the damn road is cut off 50 feet from my destination!" Jessie cursed angrily as she looked around to check the area. There were two zombies on the front side of the blockade, but both were heavily injured level ones and posed no threat. The one on the other side of the blockade was different though, it had sharp claws and looked to be in slightly better condition than the level ones. "Alright, this shouldn't be anything my uzi can't handle, just gotta be careful, its the last clip." She said as she stepped out and walked over to the wrecked cars. Just as she was about to climb over she heard a woman scream in the hotel next to her...
141111.title: Blockade

1411111.content: Luckily, the entire station was empty. Jessie decided to head to
1411111.title: Forget it, she's zombie chow, head straight...

choices: She heads into the living room
1412.content:
Jessie wanted to get into her car and drive away to safety, but knew that the hordes of undead monsters before her would likely pin her before she even got close. "Damn it..." she groaned as she took the head off of a housewife with half of her face missing and plunged one of her machetes deep into the chest of what had once been the zombie's husband.

The blade got stuck a moment, but Jessie quickly managed to pull it free and slit the throat of a man in a tennis outfit. As she pushed him aside he grabbed one of her machetes and knocked over a small group of his friends, finally giving Jessie an opening.

Not hesitating for a second, Jessie gripped her other machete tightly and began swinging wildly at the zombies trying to knock her to the ground. A particularly large corpse in a broken football helmet managed to hit the machete out of her hand when she broke free from the horde, though it was too late for him to trap her.

With one mighty tackle from her large frame Jessie sent the cadaver stumbling backwards to trip up the rest of the group pursuing her and ran across the street. She didn't want to get boxed in and not having any weapons left made her panic. Without another thought she ran inside the house across the street, locked the door and pushed a nearby table over it to hold off the dead long enough for her to think of a plan.
1412.title: Home Sweet Hell

choices: A horde of level ones arrive
An emergency call comes over the buildings PA system

Jessie was hiding in the Rustone police precinct. She had managed to reach barricade herself in the interrogation room for a day. She managed to rescue one of the surviving officers, a rookie named James ,who had joined a week before. James had managed to recover half of the stations tactical gear and weapons, and some food and water. Jessie was holding onto her AR-18 assault rifle.

http://www.imfdb.org/images/0/06/Armalit...

James was tinkering with his service pistol. The two had been in there for 3 days. James was puffing on a cigar he'd found. They were just beginning to discuss their options when,
142.title: The local police station

choices: She heads back out onto the street
She leaves through the back door into the alley
Its still too dangerous, she should head back upstairs until nightfall
144.content:
"One, two, three, four..." Jessie counted softly as she loaded the shells into the auto shotgun she had picked up on her way here. "Thats it..." She said as she moved over to the window and looked out at the streets below. The monsters that had driven her here were still moving about aimlessly, though thankfully none had followed her inside. The small group that had been waiting for her downstairs she could handle, but not an entire horde. Fortunately, on her retreat here she had found a wrecked APC with some dead soldiers and many dead zombies nearby. Most of their ammo was spent, but one of the female soldiers that had holed up inside the vehicle was still clutching her shotgun. Next to her had been an entire box filled with ammo, though she'd have no chance to use it now that her neck had been ripped open, just like her comrades outside. "Thank you... all of you." Jessie whispered silently as she took the gun and used it to clear a path into the apartment complex. That had all been 2 days ago, not long after this whole thing began. If it weren't for those brave men and women Jessie was sure she wouldn't have made it as far as she had.


Over the course of her 2 day stay here the zombies began to thin out a bit in the surrounding area, likely moving on in search of fresh prey. The soldiers Jessie encountered had killed off many of them, making it much harder for them to effectively hunt down any of the remaining survivors, even ones who were injured. "I may yet see the end of this." Jessie said softly as she took out a bottle of pills from her backpack and popped two into her mouth. "I better move out today, my medications almost gone." She shook the bottle, only to hear a few tablets tumble around inside. The appartment had plenty of food and other supplies for Jessie to wait this out, but without her pills she wouldn't last any longer than a few days waiting for rescue and it didn't look like that would happen anytime soon. The last thing she wanted to do was head back out into this mess, but knew that there was a small clinic about 3 blocks away that would probably have what she needed. "At least it isn't far." She tried to tell herself, though it felt like the place was on the other side of the world. With a deep breath she opened the door and moved out into the hallway with her shotgun ready in case something had found its way inside. Jessie was currently on the third floor and had cleared the floors below her and sealed off the higher ones when she first arrived. Still, she knew all too well that being careless could cost her and made sure to keep an eye on any open door or window she passed. In a few minutes she was back on the ground floor.
144.title: All clear?

choices: In the back seat of her wrecked sports car
15.content: Very well. Where will Cindy be starting?
15.title: Cindy Lowel, a prostitute

choices: "Lets head south to Devon's Casino, I know some people there."
"Let's head north, if we can get to my hotel we can access my equipment stash."
"Let's hurry and sneak back around to your car while they're busy."
151.content:
Cindy Lowel shoved aside a stumbling zombie as she aimed her gun at a second making its way over the barricade her and her friends had placed in front of the door. "Shit! Alison, they're getting in! Hurry up and help me hold them off!" She yelled to her friend as the zombie that had been knocked aside began returning to its feet. A bullet to the brain quickly put an end to that. "Goddamn it, we just reinforced the fucking barricade!" Alison yelled as she grabbed the shotgun she had looted from the clubs upstairs bar. "I'll be down in a minute, keep those things out just a little while longer!" Another zombie pushed aside a chair and began climbing inside while a small crowd of undead began forming outside the club. "Die, you motherfucker!" Cindy screamed as she fired another bullet into the zombiefied young man's head. "There's too damn many coming, we have to get the hell out of here, now!"


It had been only 3 days ago that Cindy paid her favorite club a visit with half of her friends. They had set out to party, spend some of their hard earned cash, and maybe even meet a few cute guys. Things were going great and the night was still young when things started going to hell. A bloodied teenager in a jacket had found his way inside off the street... and bit one of the dancers on her arm. Security had managed to pulled him off the girl quickly, but the damage was done. He had severed a major blood vessil and she was bleeding to death on the floor as the bright lights and roaring music covered the sound of her screams. Not that it mattered, the security guards soon had more than a few rowdy patrons to deal with and the number of survivors decreased until Cindy, a few of her friends, and one or two others were all that were left. On the third day of their stay in the club Cindy's friend Joan commited suicide by overdosing on cocaine she had gotten from the now dead DJ, leaving Cindy and Alison as the only 2 people left alive.


"Shit, I'm almost out of bullets!" Cindy called as she fire 2 bullets into the skull of a police officer who was almost past their ruined barricade. The gun clicked on an empty chamber and Cindy was forced to make a run for the stairs as her friend prepared their escape. "Fuck it, can you hear me Alison?! I'm comming, lets get the hell out of here!" She called as she spun around to kick a level 2 zombie in the face as it caught up with her. The heel of her red shoes caught the bastard right in the eye and slowed its movement to a halt as Cindy twisted her leg free, breaking off the long heel in the things head. "Shit, gotta get up there...!" Cindy stammered as she continued up the stairs at a slower pace thanks to her broken high heel shoe. "God damn it..." She huffed as she sprinted along towards the door leading to the clubs second floor fire exit.


"Hurry Cindy, you're almost there!" Alison called as she raised a molotov cocktail in her right hand. "Alison, what-" Cindy stammered as her friend lobbed the homemade firebomb into the hallway behind her just as an obese man came jogging around the corner. "Jesus, you're gonna light the whole place up?" Cindy panted as she caught her breath and looked back at the fire spreading up the walls as it slowly drew closer. "What if there are zombies in the alley way too?!" Alison only smiled as her friend gave her a glare. "Don't worry, I checked beforehand, its clear. I'm not as reckless as you say I am..." Cindy merely rubbed her head as she put her gun into her purse. "Let's just go..." She groaned as the two made their way to the ground, which gave Cindy a bit of trouble. "Hey, what happened to your new high heels?!" Alison asked as Cindy stumbled to the ground. "One of the fast ones almost got me... nevermind, let's worry about that later. Which way...?"
151.title: Party's over...

choices: "Let's just hurry up and get there. Left."
"We've played it safe so far, why change now? Right."
"Can't we just travel through the laser tag building itself?"
1511.content:
"Follow me, we're going to Devon's place." Alison replied as Cindy removed her damaged shoe and stuffed it into her purse next to her gun. "Devon's? Isn't that like, 3-4 blocks south of here?" She asked as she tried zipping her overstuffed purse closed. "Yeah, the big place with the rows of palm trees and the big fountain out front." Alison replied as they moved down the alleyway towards the street. "Shouldn't we use my car then? Thats a long way to walk and I've still got my keys." Cindy asked as they both crouched down next to an abandoned car that had run into the side of a building. "No, there isn't that many and we can easily outrun them. All we have to do is be careful that we don't get cornered. Trust me, that place has really good security and they'll be able to take care of anything that follows us. I should know, my brother works there." Alison said as she peeked over the hood to check for zombies.


Aside from a little boy clawing at a broken store window down the street there was no one, zombie or human, in sight. "See girl? You worry for nothing." Alison taunted as she got back up and ran across the street to the next alleyway. "Poor kid..." Cindy whispered as she joined her friend on the otherside of the road. "Most of these things are still back at the casino, I doubt many are just wandering the streets." Alison said confidently as they moved on. Cindy was silent. She wasn't sure if it really was safe or if the zombies were planning something, but a feeling in her gut told her they needed to be careful. One wrong turn is all it would take for them to end up like almost everyone else. "So Devon's place, you sure there will be people there?" Cindy asked, trying to keep her mind off the devistation around her.


"I already told you, Cin. That place is one of the most heavily guarded casinos in town. If two ladies like ourselves could hold down a fuckin' dance club for half a week that place must be doing alright." Her friend replied as they crossed another mostly empty street, trying to ignore the one armed woman pushing an empty baby stroller. "Jesus, I hope we're almost there." Cindy groaned as she resisted the urge to vomit on the sidewalk. "Almost, we just gotta make it around the laster tag building and we're home free." Alison said as she wiped a bead of sweat from her forehead. "Great, which way is the quickest?" Cindy asked as they walked out onto the street. "If we head right we'll have to make our way through a pretty long alleyway that passes around the building and if we go left we can just head past it on the open street." Cindy was sure that the alleyway was safer, but if there was nothing in the street across from them it would be a lot faster to go that way. "Okay Cin. I picked last time, you get to choose this time." Alison said as she raised her shotgun in case they needed to defend themselves.

The two set off down the street, their guns at the ready in case anything caught up with them. "So what's the first thing you'll do when you get out of here." Alison said. Cindy knew Alison was trying to keep her spirits up. "I'll definitely need some serious therapy for this." Cindy said, smiling slightly "Then I'll probably head to Vegas and find some guys to hook up with.". Alison giggled at Cindy's answer. Suddenly, the two came across,

The opened the front door to the laser tag building and walked inside. Immediately, they could tell someone had been holding out in here. There were glow sticks, and lanterns lighting up the place, giving in an almost eerie look. They spotted several crudely drawn arrows, pointing toward the back of the building. The two girls followed the arrows, keeping an eye out for any zombies. The arrows led them to a stairway that led downstairs, to some kind of basement below the building. "You think we should check it out?" Cindy said, her voice tense. "It's worth a try." Allison replied. They both proceeded down the dimly lit stairway. Then then reached a small door at the bottom. Cindy, shaking slightly, eased the door open slightly. The listened for several moments, hoping it was empty. Hearing nothing, the two girls waked into the darkened room. Cindy said as they walked through the city, heading north, as the night club started to burn behind them. They continued through the devastation of what had once been a bustling city. Now the streets were filled with an eerie silence similar to that of a graveyard. There were wrecked or abandoned vehicles scattered about the streets, light posts had been knocked over, power poles had been ripped down. Several of the building they passed had large holes in their walls or windows. And mangled corpses littered the streets, some still intact, others ripped apart. After several minutes of walking, Cindy and Alison managed to reach the hotel Alison had hidden her equipment in. Luckily, there were no zombies in sight, but the entire place stank of decay. The two girls made it to the second floor, where Alison's room was. They were outside Room 203 when they heard a strange noise in the room opposite from them, Room 204. "I'll take a look inside." Cindy said, raising her gun. She pulled the door open to find,

Stay in the car for now
152.content: Cindy woke up with her head throbbing. "What happened?" she asked herself. All she could remember was that she and her friends had been driving drunk last night, and now her expensive sports car was in riuns. She eventually managed to get a grip on her surroundings. Beyond the car, the city streets were littered with either abandoned or wrecked vehicles. Feeling uneasy, she decided to
152.title: In the back seat of her wrecked sports car

Cindy tries to get the attention of the other survivors
Cindy pulls out her gun and tries shooting the door open
153.content:
Cindy Lowel ran through the empty Rustone mall as fast as her legs would carry her as two level 2 zombies followed in hot persuit. She rounded a corner and began making her way to the escalator that would take her closer to the maintenance room where she would be able to gain access to the roof. As soon as she had gotten on she turned around and fired 3 shots from her handgun at the zombies. One went down with a headshot and the other took 2 rounds to the chest, causing it to stumble over the dead one as it tried to make it past. Cindy fired off one last round to finish it and stepped off the escalator onto the second floor.


"Shit, I've only got one bullet left... at least I'm almost there..." She said to herself as she followed the bright green arrow spray painted on the wall. After a few minutes of uneventful walking she came to two more arrows pointing down a hallway towards a security door. "Thank god..." Cindy mumbled as she played the events of the last 3 days over in her head. She had been with one of her best clients and they were going to see a movie and have dinner together before heading back to his house.


The movie had just ended when people in blood-stained clothes began pouring into the theater and attacking everyone in sight. Both Cindy and her "date" managed to make it out one of the back fire exits before being overwhelmed, but Jeremy was heavily injured from defending Cindy and coughing up blood by the time they got to his car. Cindy tried to help him as best she could, but he passed away shortly after pulling up in his driveway. After trying to spend the night at his house Cindy was forced to flee when the undead hordes began breaking in. During her escape Cindy had lost her own handgun, but was able to take the one Jeremy kept in his car.


After a day of running around the city trying to find help the car ran out of gas and Cindy had to continue on foot. Fortunately, she spoted a sign saying that survivours were meeting up at the nearby mall on the roof where they would try to alert help. Since she had no better option Cindy began her short journey to the Rustone mall. Now, after days of avoiding zombies she was finally at her destination. Cindy turned the knob on the security door... only to have it jam instead of opening. It was locked. "No, no! I'm so fucking close...!" She shouted as quietly as she was able. Cindy had made it to her destination... now she just needed a way inside.
153.title: Why is it always a mall...?

choices: Go back down the stairs and head back into the mall
Try to knock the zombie off the side of the building
Beat the zombie to death with the golf club
1531.content:
Cindy pounded the door one last time lightly with her fist before turing away. "Damn." She cursed lightly under her breath as she walked back out into the mall. "At least this place seems empty... not that I would want to stick around and find out." She put her gun back into her purse and ventured a little further away from the hall towards a directory next to a hair and make up store. "Okay... now where can I find a blunt instrament to bust open that door?" She said to herself as she skimmed down the list of nearby stores. "Let's see... according to this there's a sporting goods store up ahead... not likely the type of place to stock up on sledgehammers or crowbars. Guess it'll have to do though." With that she quickly made her way to the store and walked inside.


The interrior was small, but was lined wall to wall with useful gear and potental weapons. Its clean floor and distinct lack of blood stains meant it had also managed to avoid an infestation of undead like most of the rest of the mall. "I never was a big sports fan, but after this I might have to rethink my opinion." Cindy mused to herself as she grabbed a football helmet and some padding to protect herself. "Not exactly high fashion, but it'll definately help me stay alive." She said in a bittersweet tone as she looked herself over in a small mirror. "I just hope I get rescued before this thing starts to smell." She spent a few minutes searching for a sutible weapon that would allow her to open the door. It couldn't be too heavy, but had to have a strong enough impact to get her inside.


"Ah-ha! Here we go!" She called out as she grabbed a 9 iron from a nearby shelf. It was heavier than she expected, but should easily allow her to break the door open. "Alright, now I just have to get back before any more of these disgusting things show up." The trip back to the security door was just as uneventful as the one to the store and Cindy soon found herself staring at the same knob that had denied her access before. With 3 solid whacks the lock gave and broke with a loud thumping sound. Cindy pulled the door free and began climbing the stairs up to the roof. "Finally, all I have to do now is wait for a helicopter or something to come along and pick me up."


She turned the knob on one final door and stepped out onto the mall's roof. The floor was a mess of trash and various discarded items, all scattered about. Cindy paided no attention to this however, as a man in a blood smeared t-shirt was standing over the edge and looking down at the city below him. "Whoa, hey over there!" Cindy called out as she took a few steps closer. "You shouldn't stand so close to the edge! Do you guys have room for one more?" The man seemed to ignore her comment at first, only to turn around just as she was about to ask him if he heard her. His entire lower jaw was hanging loose from his mouth and about half of his face seemed to have been ripped or peeled off. "Oh my god!" Cindy yelled out in surprise as the lowly zombie began shuffling closer...
1531.title: "Hello? Is anyone there?"

choices: A group of survivors show up
She decides to search the roof for any useful supplies
15312.content: Cindy though fast and swung her golf club at the zombies face. The force wasn't enough to kill him, but sent him close to the edge of the roof. Cindy started to feel anger rise up inside of her. "Why did you bastards have to ruin everything?" she shouted at the zombie before she threw a hard punch to his face, knocking him over the edge of the roof to the floor below. She winced as the zombie landed on the pavement with a sickening crack. She started to calm down as she sat near the edge and looked over the destruction. "If I get out of this, I'd better find someplace else to live." she though to herself. After several hours of waiting,
15312.title: Try to knock the zombie off the side of the bui...

choices: She comes to her senses just in time to defend herself
She manages to will herself back to her feet and makes a run for it
15313.content:
It took Cindy only a moment to shake off the shock of seeing the mangled abomination and she quickly knocked it on its back with one fierce swing. The zombie made a gurgling sound as blood started pouring from its mouth, but it was clear that the fight was over. With two final whacks Cindy caved in the man's skull and was just about to turn around when a second zombie grabbed her from behind. The both of them fell to the ground as Cindy dropped her golf club, which landed just under 2 feet out of reach. "Ugh... you rotten smelly pusbag!" Cindy groaned, wishing that her football attire had come with a protective mask. While it didn't have that, it did offer her protection against the zombie's sharp fingernails, allowing her to better fight off the bulky woman. After a few seconds of struggling and avoiding being choked Cindy was able to overpower the zombie and throw it off.


The large undead woman tried to get back to her feet, but Cindy made it to her golf club before she even got close. Teeth and blood sprayed from the decaying woman's mouth as the right side of her head was torn off with the impact. "Eww... you were a ripe one, weren't you?" Cindy muttered as she brought the club down on the woman's mangled head for good measure. "Whew... glad thats over..." She said to herself as she lowered the club and took a few deep breaths. She walked past the fresh corpses and headed around to the main part of the roof. The sight that was there to greet her wasn't pretty...


Amoung the various discarded pieces of litter and garbage were around a dozen human corpses. Some were covered in sheets and blankets, a few were slumped over in chairs next to a table in the center of the roof, but most were simply laying uncovered in the hot sun gathering flies. Many had their torso's ripped open or were even missing whole limbs, likely inflicted by a slumped over man in the corner with large claws on his hands. His head seemed mostly intact except for a massive wound from a sharp blow to the forehead that had leaked blood all over the front of his shirt. A single living zombie stirred next to the corpse of a young boy covered by a bedsheet and let out a groan as it slowly got to its feet. Cindy had no way of knowing, but this man had once been the boy's father and was the second to last survivor to die here. The fury of losing his son had allowed him to protect the others for a while, but in the end the wounds he suffered were too great and he died seconds before his best friend was beaten to death by his zombiefied wife.


"Oh my god..." Cindy whispered as she took a step back. "What... just... what the fuck happened here?" She was in complete and utter shock. The safe zone she had been trying to reach was gone, the city was crawling with more and more zombies by the hour, and all she had to show for her effort so far was a rescue that would probably never come. "Its... its all over... I'm gonna die here..." She moaned as she sunk to her knees. "Everyone's dead... all my friends... the city is lost..." She hardly even paid any attention to the large zombiefied man that was now only a few feet away...
15313.title: So much for that...

choices: Leaves the mall to search for help elsewhere
Begins converting the mall into her base
153131.content:
A loud growl snapped Cindy back to reality just as the zombie lunged at her with its arms outstretched. She raised her golf club just in time to stop the undead man from advancing and shoved him back as she got to her feet. Overcome by anger, she let out a furious yell as she put an end to the zombie before he'd even known what hit him. Cindy dropped her club next to the dead body and walked over to the table to have a seat before she collapsed. Tears filled her eyes as the pain she had kept bottled up for days was finally let out. She took off her football helmet and threw it to the ground as she took her gun out of her purse. She had one bullet left. One left. She could end it all right here, no more sorrow, no more violence, no more of this nightmare. She placed the gun to her temple and began shaking as she tried to pull the trigger.


A single shot rang out as the empty gun fell to the table, its last round finally spent. Cindy felt fresh tears run down her face as she looked down at the gun she had pulled away from her head at the last second. "I-I couldn't do it..." She moaned as she buried her face in her hands. "I want to live... my whole world is gone... but I want to live!" A cool breeze began blowing as Cindy tried to think of what she could possibly do next. Could she leave? The helicopter would likely never come and there probably wasn't anything else she could do to escape here... though the mall DID have plenty of supplies for her to live off of and she could probably survive here for a while. Both options seemed almost suicidal, but what else could she do?


Cindy got up and picked up her helmet and golf club off of the ground. "I may not have made any progress since this whole mess started, but that changes now. I've been shit on all my life, but I got through the good times and the bad. Cindy Lowel doesn't bow to anyone, today I'm gonna show that... even if I die, it'll be fighting those bastards to the death!" She shouted defiantly as she came to a descision. "Alright, I've made it this far... I'm not gonna die now!" With that she...
153131.title: Should she stay or should she go?

The entire lot was empty except for an abandoned black limo sitting on the opposite end of the lot. She made her way to it. Luckily, it was unlocked and free of any occupants. Even better, there was a large stash of guns and ammunition in the passenger area. Cindy managed to start the limo and drove out of the parking lot, toward the center of Rustone. When Cindy reached the Old Rustone Strip, which was lined with its best casinos, hotels, and strip clubs,

15313111.title: The limo runs out of gas

15313112.content:
As Cindy drove past a strip joint called "The Pink Corset" a man shouted out to her from behind a barricade of chairs and tables covering most of the front door. After making sure the place was clear Cindy grabbed an uzi and stepped out into the parking lot to greet him. "Yo, Brent, Kelly, Sue, Donna... we got company here!" The man called to his compainions as he pulled down a chair to talk to Cindy face to face. "Hey dollface... the name is Marty. Pleased to meet ya." He said as he stuck out his hand. "I'm... Cindy. Just call me Cindy. What the hell are you people doing out here?" She said as she pushed his hand away. "Ah yeah, me and some of da boys came out here for our buddy Kent to celebrate his bachlor party. It was going great until his bride to be and some of her grilfriends ripped him apart. Must be some kind of virus or something, it came through here a few days back, but we were smart enough to barricade the place and shoot anyone who was bitten or scratched." The man said as he was joined by a younger man and some scantily dressed women. "This whole thing is so awful." A young woman with curly blond hair said as she moved closer to the man standing next to Marty. "I had to kill my best friend before she turned, but what could I do? It was just like the movies, if an infected person comes into contact with you, you'll become one of them."


Cindy shook her head as she rested an arm on the doorway. "I'm not so sure this is an infection. Have you seen those fuckers up close? They keep moving even with half their body gone and have god damn glowing eyes!" The young woman began to look like she might cry upon hearing Cindy say this. "W-what do you know?! They would have killed us, I had to kill her... I had to..." She whispered as she shivered a little. "Whoa whoa, Sue, calm down okay...? I'm sure this woman is mistaken. Those things can't be supernatural, it doesn't make any sense." Another woman said as she put an arm around Sue. "This thing has been pretty hard on us all, but could you kindly keep your ideas to yourself lady? That girls been through enough." The younger man said as he stepped between Cindy and the two girls. "Hey whatever, I'm just telling you what I've seen..." Cindy replied as she took a step back. "My name is Brent, miss Cindy." The man replied as he looked Cindy over. "By the way, if you don't mind telling us... why are you wearing that football get up?" Cindy paused for a moment when she remembered that she was stilling wearing the football outfit she'd found at the mall.


"Look, I was alone and couldn't find anything better. I wanted some protection in case one of those things jumped me." She replied as she fiddled with her uzi a bit. "Look, can I please come in? Its great to finally meet some other people, but I-" A loud roar cut her off as something big jumped onto the limo behind her. "The hell?! Did I just hear one of those things jump on top of my ride?!" Cindy yelled as she spun around to see what had found them. "Jesus... just what in the fuck IS THAT THING?!" Cindy gasped as she backed up against the barricaded door. The figure standing atop the limo was about six and a half feet tall, but its arms were large and swollen looking. With a simple flick of the wrist it tore the roof off of the front part of the limo and tossed it aside like it had been made of paper. One of the woman inside the strip club let out a scream as Marty told them to get back away from the door. "Good luck out there sweet thing! We'll try to find a way to help from in here!" He shouted before placing the chair back into its spot on the top of the barricade. "Yeah... thanks..." Cindy groaned as she pointed her uzi at the Brawler and prepared to engage it alone...
15313112.title: Alone no longer

choices: Climbed back inside the limo to attempt to endure the horde from there...
Makes a run for the front of the strip club...
153131121.content:
The Brawler let out another roar as it jumped down from the limo and began moving towards Cindy with one of its arms extended out in front of it like a battering ram. Cindy opened fire as soon as she lined up her shot and emptied a full clip into it before quickly moving out of the way of its tackle. The thing swung its now bleeding arm to knock her down, missing by only a few inches. Cindy quickly backed up towards the limo as she loaded a fresh clip and began pelting it with more bullets. The thing was faster than most of the zombies she had seen and blocked most of her shots with its arms, but still appeared to be taking damage and slowing down a bit. By the time the second clip was spent its arms looked like raw slabs of meat with some bone now visible under the mangled flesh. "Goddam it, two fucking clips and its still coming! I'm almost outta ammo!" Cindy yelled as she jumped on top of the limo and climbed inside the ripped open top.


The Brawler smashed one of its mighty fists onto the trunk, causing the whole car to violently shake, and hopped up to corner the prey waiting for it inside. It peeked in through the roof and growled when it noticed Cindy slumped over on the floor, which was littered with spilled guns and ammunition. "Smile, you big bastard." Cindy quipped as she pulled the trigger on a sawn-off shotgun she had recovered from the mess. A large wound opened on the Brawlers upper torso as it howled in pain. It attempted to back out and began to clutch it chest, but a second shot took out a good chunk of the monsters forehead and caused it to fall backwards, dead. A single loud thud was heard as its body hit the pavement and Cindy quickly got to her feet. "That was a lot closer than I would have liked..." She said as she reloaded her uzi and shotgun. "Might as well take both, I doubt that was the last big ass zombie I'll see."


Cindy jumped down from the wrecked limo and began to survey the damage as a couple of people appeared on the roof of the strip club with hunting rifles in their hands. "Hey girl, you get that ugly son of a bitch?" A familar voice called. It was Brent and one of the girls Cindy had meet near the club entrance. "Yeah, nice of you to show up when the fight has just ended." Cindy taunted as she pulled a bit of twisted metal from the spot where the Brawler had pounded the limo. She doubted it would run now with all the damage that had been done. "Sorry, it was hard climbing up the ladder with these sniper rifles." Brent called back. "Hows your ride? Donna here has a bit of auto repair experience... maybe she can help?" Cindy let out a sigh as she tossed the broken piece of metal aside and rubbed her head. She didn't want to join up with a bunch of people she had just met, but going alone without a vehicle or backup was probably suicide. "The limos completely fucked. That damn thing ruined the gas tank and knocked one of the wheels loose, can I join up with you guys?" Cindy replied as she lightly kicked the side of the limo. Before Brent or Donna could answer a new problem revealed itself.


A series of loud moans echoed up and down the streets as a mass of footsteps began sounding off in the distance, some of which were moving pretty fast. Seems all the noise has drawn a fresh horde of zombies. "Shit, I can hear them from here... there could be hundreds of them..." Cindy said worriedly as she backed up against the limo. "Hurry get inside!" Brent called as a loud groan sounded from a nearby alleyway. "Shit, one of those things is close behind you, run Cindy!" Donna called as she pointed her sniper rifle a little ways past Cindy to try and find the zombie. "Crap... guess I better move." Cindy said under her breath as she...

155.title: Shoot a zombie and pick your prize!

choices: She finds a group of survivors
1552.content: Cindy managed to fire her last few rounds at the remaining zombies, killing them effortlessly. Throwing the machine gun aside, she listened for any more zombies. An eerie silence hung over her. "Looks like it's safe to head out." Cindy said to herself. She knocked down the barricade that kept the zombies out and walked out. She was devastated by what she saw. Game booths and concession stands were demolished beyond repair. Various human corpses littered the ground. The sight gave her the creeps. "I'd better get out of here." she thought to herself as she started walking through the park. After walking several steps, her foot treaded on something hard. She tensed up, but relaxed when she looked down and saw it was a crowbar. "This should help me fend off those monsters for now." Cindy said to herself as she continued through the park. Several minutes later,
1552.title: The horde has been elimenated

choices: She searches some of the other vehicles for supplies
15521.content: Cindy soon reached the parks exit, which led to the parking lot. She stared at the devastation that surrounded her. There were vehicles that were either wrecked or abandoned. She started to prowl through the wreckage. Several minutes later,
15521.title: She reaches the parks exit

info.brief_description: Five more survivors face the undead.
info.description:
They thought it was the end... but it was only the beginning.

On September 21, 2012 an army of reanimated corpses overwhelmed the Pennsylvania city of Bitterwood. Many brave people were lost in the conflict that ensued and the U.S. government refuses to disclose any details of the incident at this time, though one thing is certain. Bitterwood was not the end.

Exactly 2 weeks after Bitterwood was overrun the U.S. military successfully exterminated the last zombie and the ravaged city is slowing being rebuilt piece by piece. The losses and pain borne by the living survivors is infinite, but their lives are slowly returning to normal now that their ordeal is over. However, across the country a small city has become the target of the next zombie uprising. More people will die, more blood will be shed, and more questions will still go unanswered. For the city of Ruststone a fresh hell awaits.


The survivors

Jack Crowley Age:31 Ht: 5'11 Profession: Professional gambler

Appearance: Jack's the kinda guy who loves to show off his wealth with a nice suit and tie. Underneath the darkest sunglasses money can buy he hides beautiful blue eyes. Usually sports five-o-clock shadow due to his habit of never shaving off his current beard until he loses 3 games in a row. (He considers a brand new beard lucky.)

Description: Born to a fairly wealthy family he had an easy, yet boring, life for most of his childhood. All that changed in high school when he learned to play poker from a buddy and took half the school for all they were worth. Finally realizing his calling in life, he decided to drop out at grade 11 and hit the road to make his own fortune. He doesn't always come out on top and there have been many hard times, but he is able to make a decent living doing what he loves and sees Ruststone as just another city to fleece a few gullible suckers.

Personality: Cocky, sarcastic, and downright rude to most of the people he meets. Many women have fallen for his charm and good looks... only to quickly find themselves unable to stand his company for more then a few minutes. Still, he does have a decent heart underneath the vile outer shell: 10% of all his winnings go to various charities, mostly ones that benefit children.


Marie Lopez Age:19 Ht:5'4 Profession: Works at a bookstore back in her home town

Appearance: She has long black hair with bright pink highlights and often wears mini-skirts and tube tops. She loves jewelry, especially necklaces and earrings, so she almost never leaves home with less then two or three sparkling and extravagant objects hanging around her head or from her ears. In short, she'll wear anything sparkly or cute, but doesn't have a very good sense of fashion.

Description: She and her sister had left their hometown on a road trip to visit their father while he was in California. They had only planned on staying in Ruststone a day or two... and then they have to change their schedule to factor in one new variable: The dead were walking the earth. Now they'll both have to put off visiting their father and instead try to survive the living hell they've found themselves drawn into.

Personality: If the words "squee", "glomp", or "rainbow-frosted sweetness" mean anything to you then you probably know all you need to. Unlike her bitter ill-temper twin all Marie wants to do all day is have fun, whether its by hanging out with friends, reading or watching her favorite anime and manga, or just relaxing in the sun. This often annoys her sister. She does have a temper, but good luck getting her to stay mad at you.


Kenji Takashi Age:26 Ht:5'10 Profession: Martial Arts instructer

Appearance: Unless he is teaching a class he'll likely be wearing a dark blue jacket and sweat pants. He'll sometimes wear sunglasses and is never seen without his prize medallion necklace, a gift from his beloved grandfather.

Description: His family immigrated to the U.S. from Japan when he was only 9 years old, which made it a little bit difficult for him to adjust to his new environment. Eventually his family moved to Ruststone where his grandfather owned a school of martial arts. He didn't have many customers, but he got by just fine and was overjoyed to have young Kenji begin working with him that summer. By the same time next year Kenji was a top competitor in all the fighting tournaments he participated in. Things were going well for him until the night his grandfather was fatally wounded defending a woman from an armed purse snatcher. That horrible incident made Kenji colder, but he is still friendly and respectful to everyone he meets.

Personality: His tough-looks and intimidating presence hide a kind and warm-hearted man behind them, but his character always shines through when it matters. He values honor, loyalty, and kindness as his biggest virtues. He will always defend those weaker then him and as a result has gotten into many fights over the years, which usually end with his opponent laying in the dirt.


Jessie Tenenbaum Age:86 Ht:5'7 Profession: Retired

Appearance: At first glance she would appear to be a bitter old paranoid woman who hates children and thinks everyone is out to get her. In actuality, she only thinks the government is out to get her. While she is usually dressed in standard old lady clothes (with a hidden bullet proof vest underneath, naturally) she also keeps the old S.W.A.T. team riot armor of her deceased husband handy in case the threat level goes up.

Description: She and her husband were both born in Germany but left when they were each under a year old. After meeting in Austria they got together and moved to America in the late seventies. Some say her husband was the only human being she truly loved and when he passed away she was devastated. Fortunately, he left her more then enough money for her retire and maintain her "base of operations." (In reality, just the attic of her house.) Due to her odd behavior and unlady-like nature most people leave her alone, although she is still visited occasionally by salesmen or Jehovah's witnesses. Known to many of the neighborhood children as "that crazy old bitch."

Personality: Rude, suspicious, and distrustful of anyone she meets, especially government agents. She is fairly paranoid, but has always believed to be "better safe then sorry" and isn't one to take chances. After all, when the city's flooded and she has the only emergency raft in town who'll be the one laughing?


Cindy Lowel Age: 37 Ht: 5'9 Profession: Prostitute

Appearence: With short blonde hair, shimmering brown eyes, and sexy pink lipstick Cindy has been turning heads her whole life. Her attire consists entirely of short skirts, tight shirts, and a huge collection of shoes. While reasonalby modest, she is constantly trying to find new ways to wear the most revealing clothing in public as possible, to the point she has had some minor trouble with the law regarding indecency charges. But hey, what's a ticket or two when you look this good?

Description: When she was a little girl she only wanted 3 things in life: a loving husband, a nice sports car, and to be a princess. By the time she was 19 these things changed to: a partner who's good in bed, a vibrator for when she doesn't have a partner who's good in bed, and more accessories for her pimped out sports car. After wasting 3 years of her life working for an asshole pimp who treated her like shit she decided she wanted to be her own boss. She acomplished this goal by beating her former pimp within an inch of his life and taking half of his girls with her. Now she makes a living by doing what she's done best since high school... sleeping with anything that moves and beating the hell out of anyone who disses her or her girls. When not hanging out with her friends or sleeping with a client she'll often be found in one of Rustone's many clubs or bars looking for a good time.

Personality: Rude and harsh to most of the people she meets and surprisingly kind to the few people she cares about. She has a nasty habit of offending people by saying exactly whats on her mind or starting fights and arguements for petty reasons. While she has a short temper she is also amzingly street smart and knows how to take care of herself, which is why she keeps a gun on her person at all times.


The location

Rustone city

Rustone City, or "Mini Vegas" as it is sometimes called is a small, but prosperous city located a little over 100 miles outside of Las Vegas itself. Despite its isolation it gets a fair number of travelers and tourists passing through thanks to its many attractions such as Silverstone amusement park, which is located only about 4 miles outside the city. While casinos, bars, and strip clubs can be found all over the city it still manages a wholesome family image due to its large numbers of all-ages celebrations and old family-owned businesses. The city even has several old timey streets and buildings that look almost the same as they did 100 years ago.


Safe areas

Churches

Because the zombies were revived with dark magic they cannot cross holy ground. This means that any church the survivors come to will protect them from any and all types of zombie. Zombies cannot enter churches by themselves but can be knocked/pulled/pushed into one. If this happens they will be unable to move and lose any power they have until they exit (their eyes will still glow red while inside). Many churches all over the city have been fortified to offer more protection and often contain useful items that the survivors may find useful like food or ammo. Some people have even left behind maps and signs that give directions to nearby safe areas. The universal symbol for a safe area is a triangle with a cross inside it and will also often have an arrow under it or above it pointing in the direction of the safe room. Keep in mind that while most other survivors are more then happy to let others inside there may be a few selfish or insane survivors who will deny entry to others and possibly even attack them.


Non-holy safe locations

Several areas have been fortified to protect against zombies with varying success. Because these areas lack the holy protection given by churches they can be destroyed by zombies. Many of these places are damaged but still standing while others have been wiped out completely. Like churches, many of these locations have useful items left behind by other survivors and may not be all that friendly to newcomers.
The symbol for this type of safe area is a triangle inside a square.


Re-supply locations

Many survivors discard excess supplies once they find improvements or are unable to carry any more. While a lot of these supplies end up being thrown on the ground or abandoned in hard to reach locations some people are kind enough to leave extra supplies in places were other survivors are likely to find them. These places are simply known as Re-supply locations. They range in size and scope from a few cases of bullets and a bottle of water in an empty trash can to a small garages worth of weapons, food, and medical aid. Important to note is that re-supply locations are NOT SAFE AREAS and in most cases survivors are just as vulnerable to attack as any other time. They are marked with a large R in a circle to let people know what they are. If one of these locations is cleaned out it is common courtesy to cross out the R symbol so no one will waste their time checking it for supplies.


Zombies

Zombies are humans that were brought back to life with dark magic. Since they were revived with dark magic getting bitten, scratched, or injured by them DOES NOT turn you into one. However anyone who is killed by one DOES turn into one of them. They come in 2 types:normal and special.


Normal: This type of zombie has 3 levels depending on how strong they are. When a person is killed they turn into a level one zombie(unless they become a special zombie). They level up by killing living cretures.

Level One: This level of zombie looks like a normal human except for its glowing red eyes. It moves slowly and has only half of the strangth of a normal human.It can be killed with a headshot, a shot to the heart, or by burning it to death. Rarity:*

Level Two: This level is as fast and strong as an adult human and has sharp clawlike fingernails along with pointed teeth. It is also more violent then a level one. This level can not be killed by fire or a shot to the heart like a level one. Rarity:**

Level Three: This level is extremly deadly. It looks like a monsterous human with glowing red eyes and a pentagram symbol somewhere on its body. This pentagram is its only weak point and must be destroyed to kill it. All level 3 zombies look fairly humanoid but each has a special unique ability that no other zombie has. When using this abilities their pentagram symbols glow bright red, making them easier to spot. Rarity:****


Special: This type has no levels, instead each type has a different ability. Only about 1 in 15 people who are killed become a special zombie (Any animals killed become Beasts).

Pyro: A pyro moves as fast as a level two zombie, but walks most of the time. It looks exactly like a normal human except for its glowing redish-orange skin. Its skin is hot to the touch and many of the things it touches burst into flames or sometimes explode. It is completely immune to fire. They are not hard to kill, but whenever one dies its entire body bursts into flames that quickly spred. When a human gets too close the pyro will raise its body tempature causeing anything within a 5 foot radius to catch fire or melt. Pyro's hate water and are often found in places where they can stay dry. Rarity:****

Mimic: A mimic is the only zombie that doesn't have glowing red eyes...because it tries to disguise itself as a living human. It can walk or run and even perfectly immitate human speech. While they may seem human, there are several things that can give them away:A mimic can survive wounds that wound kill a normal human(If someone walks up to you missing half of their face or with most of their blood gone and ask for help, they are a mimic.), mimics don't have heartbeats, mimics will try to lead living humans into danerous situations or to other zombies, and mimics are often found in small groups while pretending to be survivors. So when ever you find survivers in something like a sealed room with no food or water and they have been there a long time, they are mimics. A mimics weakspot is its upper torso, a headshot will only slow them down. Rarity:****

Deathtouch: A deathtouch is perhaps the most deadly type of zombie that can be found, it is also the most rare. The walk slowly and are not vary strong, but are vary dangerous. A deathtouch is easily spoted as it is surrounded by a deep red mist. This mist is highly toxic and coming into contact with it can be fatal. Fourtunately the mist only extends about 3 feet from the zombies body. The zomies body itself is red like the mist and simply touching it is almost instantly fatal as its entire body is filled with a deadly virus. Deathtouches have no weakpoints, the only way to stop them is reduceing them to paste, which is vary difficult as their skin is twice as strong as a normal humans and they can't be killed by fire. Rarity:*****

Nightmare: These are probaly one of the most fearsome types of zombie. They have the very eerie ability of absorbing all manner of illumination within a 30 foot radius. The veil of shadows remain over their corpses after they die, so no one knows what they really look like. Things like flash lights or even floodlights are useless agenst them as they absorb the light itself. All that is known about them is that they are vaugely humanoid, they have two legs and a head, but they have four arms. They also seem to have the strangth and speed of an average human. The only things that are visible in their shroud of night is their 4 glowing red eyes. They are often identified right away as they look like large black clouds moving slowly over fields and streets. They often also allow other zombies to hide themselves in its black veil which makes it extreamly dangerous.(The other zombies eyes don't glow in the shadows like the nightmare's do.) Rarity:*****

Carrier: These zombies look more like giant monsterous bats then humans. It has six human-like arms(but no legs) that it uses to carry other zombies(except sumo) to locations that they couldn't normally reach. The have two pairs of wings and stand between 8-10 feet tall. They can be killed with a headshot and its wings are very weak and can be easily burned or shot off. If it loses its wings it will crawl along the ground and claw and bite at living humans. Rarity:****

Beast: The name beast refers to all the animals that were zombiefied by the event that took place 5 days ago. These animals are all fast moving and ruthless. Birds that once sang happily outside windows now swarm and peck to death anything left alive. Deer that once avoided humans will now hunt them down and gore them to death. Fish that would just swim in the rivers and ponds now rip apart anything near them(except Swimmers). All zombie animals have glowing red eyes and can be killed with a headshot. Rarity:*

Digger: A digger will find one spot it likes and remain there. It digs holes to hide in with its huge claws. It grabs people and will drag them underground. It can be killed with a headshot, but rarely sticks its head above ground. Its claws are razor sharp and can easily cut through metal. Diggers can also shoot tentacules from its mouth to snare pray. Rarity:****

Slimer: The slimer is a nasty zombie named for its 3 different slime abilites. The first is the red slime attack. Red slime is acidic and can melt steel. The second is the blue slime attack. Blue slime is sticky and doesn't wash off with water, it wears off after about 5 minutes. Finally, there is the purple slime attack. Purple slime is highly flamable and will burst into flames in hot areas. It may also explode. The slimer moves slowly, but can spit slime up to 50 feet away. Slimers usually have slime dripping from their mouths. One headshot is all it takes to kill them, but their corpse will dissolve into a random type of slime. Rarity:****

Ghost: A zombie that is very likely to induce paranoia in survivors who encounter it. At first glance it appears to look just like a level one zombie, but in reality it is far more deadly. It can become transparent and intangible for up to one minute at a time allowing to harmlessly pass through anything it wants (except a church). It is as fast and strong as a normal human, but is immune to fire even when it isn't intangible. Lastly, its ability to move through objects only applies to it and other zombies cannot be affected by it. Rarity:****

Swarmer: A somewhat bloated-looking zombie that is home to thousands of hellish insects. Upon injury or death, it releases them to seek out survivors. Oddly, these insects don't have glowing eyes like the zombies and seem to be normal and unzombified, yet appear out of nowhere whenever a Swarmer is created, making them supernatural in nature. Swarmers come in three types (although it is impossible to tell them apart from each other based on appearances): spider, ant, and wasp. Rarity:***

Brawler: An aggressive zombie with large mutated arms that excels at beating survivors to death. Due to its massive upper body strength it can easily climb up the sides of buildings and cliffs, along with being able to throw objects with moderate accuracy. Despite its impressive physical attributes it can easily be kill with a headshot or burning to death. While fairly unintelligent it does have enough sense to use its massive arms as shields when under attack, making it somewhat hard to kill with low-caliber weapons. Rarity:****

Bride: A strange and horrifying zombie with deathly pale skin, sickly white hair, and glowing white eyes. Despite its terrifying looks it is actually a passive zombie that wanders aimlessly while crying or moaning. It is able to talk, but only speaks one word: the name of its lost lover. Although it may seem harmless at first it is actually one of the more deadly zombies. When it comes into close contact with a Groom both will be driven to a rage. In this enraged state they both have glowing red eyes and will gain access to their special abilities. The Brides abilities are increased speed, agility, and the ability to summon white fire. This fire is an otherworldly flame that the Bride can use to envelop and protect herself or shoot at enemies. Unlike normal fire, white fire can burn on anything and eat through any substance. It cannot be put out with water and stops burning after a short period of time. A bride is always female. Rarity:*****

Groom: A melancholy zombie with shiny black hair, shimmering black skin, and dark void-like eyes that wanders from place to place much like its counterpart. It too can only speak a single word: the name of its lost lover. Like the Bride, it is passive until the two come in contact with each other. Its special abilities are hardened skin that stops bullets and most types of blunt force and enlonged sickle-like talons that can slice through anything. A groom is always male. Rarity:*****

Voodoo: The deadly Voodoo zombie is passive, but also one of the most dangerous specials a survivour can encounter. Just as its name implies, whatever anyone does to it they suffer themselves. Even worse is the fact that there is no way to tell a Voodoo from a normal level one zombie unless you harm it. Luckily, whenever one is in the area survivors will feel occasional sharp pains that intensifly slightly as it draws closer. Rarity:****

Infector: The Infector is a really nasty zombie that carries a powerful virus in its fangs. One bite will transform a survivor into one of the undead in a matter of seconds. Survivors that are transformed this way have a 50% greater chance of becoming a special zombie than if they were killed by the zombies in another way. Dispite also having sharp claws, they are not poisonous and seem to be a last resort if the Infector is unable to bite its prey. Killing an Infector is as easy as killing any level 2 zombie so long as the survivour avoids being bitten. Oddly, an Infectors eyes glow a bright sickly green instead of red like the other zombies which makes it somewhat easier to spot in a crowd. Rarity:****


The rules

1. You can not introduce any new zombies of your own, please use the ones listed.

2. Keep in mind the story begins 3 days after the zombies appeared, the survivors all start out alone in a location were they have managed to find shelter. There are no other people alive(except for the few other survivors that might be found later).

3. Keep this realistic, nothing cartoonish or stupid.

4. Survivors MAY die.

5. Cursing, violence, gore, adult content/situations, and nudity is fine. In fact most of those things are expected.

6. Sex is allowed with a few conditions:
a. No sex when there is the danger of a zombie attack.
b. This is a zombie story, not a porn story, if chapters start focusing too much on sex they will be deleted or edited.

7. All the characters live in the same city so they may meet and join up with each other.

8. Finally, characters are not allow leaving the area unless they are rescued somehow, and they can't be rescued before chapter 20.


IMPORTANT NOTE: When this interactive was first created I used several ideas given to me by friends that I've grown to dislike and have removed or rewritten. As such, many elements have changed and some older chapters may be out of date. As such, please reread the important information above to get up to date on what is going on. I thank you all for reading and apologize for any inconvenience this might have caused. I'll also try to make sure something like this doesn't happen again.
